title: Remodeled studio w/ Bay View in prime Pacific Heights HARDWOOD FLOORS!
description: This completely REMODELED and HUGE studio is located at the Broadway Crown Towers Apartments in prime Pacific Heights (on Broadway Street). This unit features gorgeous hardwood floors throughout, a fully REMODELED kitchen including all full-size appliances: maple wood cabinetry, refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, garbage disposal and DISHWASHER! In addition, this apartment home has a dinette room attached to the kitchen (tons of cabinetry in the kitchen) and a large bathroom. Huge bay windows in the main living room give lots of light to the entire apartment. INCREDIBLE Bay Views can be seen from the living room (literally you walk into the living room and are struck by the gorgeous water views!). In addition, this unit has a huge walk-in closet (with window) which residents often use as their bedroom due to its large size. This unit is on the north side of the building making it very private and picturesque!To view this unit please contact the on-site manager Egan at  show contact infoFor more building information please visit our website at copelandparkproperties.comNo pets please.Located in Prime Pacific Heights, 1770 Broadway is a one of a kind, stately 1920's building. title: Cute, cute, cute 1906 Sunnyside Cottage
description: Cute, cute, cute 1906 Sunnyside Cottage. Efficient spacing. Enter into a large Foyer with immediate adjoining Living Room, Bedroom and remodeled Kitchen. Off the Kitchen is a remodeled Bathroom and Porch with potential multiple uses. immediately outside off the porch is a lovely deck with a bright overlook of the recently landscaped rear yard. Mature fruit trees offer fresh fruit. A rear yard artificial turf area accommodates children and/or canine family members. There is interior access from the main living floor to a pair of Bonus spaces: A large room with its own Bathroom may be used as a Den/Family Room or private Office. A smaller rear space toward the rear of this floor is staged as an office, but truthfully you have choices to make. Beyond that room is a basement Laundry Area, and that leads to the rear Yard. There is a one small car Parking Garage and a contiguous Potting Closet with it's own access to the rear yard. Did I say Cute, cute, cute emphatically enough?

title: Views, space and luxe finishes in the heart of the City
description: Views, space and luxe finishes in the heart of the City. This stunning, one bedroom plus den home offers the urban dweller amazing access to some of the City's best amenities, outdoor restaurants, retail, bike paths and parks, all within walking distance. Designed by world-renowned architect Bernardo Fort-Brescia, Linea was created for those that appreciate modern design. Walls of glass showcase the amazing views from every window in both the bedroom and living room which provide phenomenal light throughout the day. With its southeast orientation and location in one of the sunniest parts of the City, the home is flooded with sunshine. Unit 512 offers a large bedroom with walk in closet, den and spacious bath. European cabinetry in the kitchen with polished quartz countertops and stone backsplash. Hardwood floors throughout the common areas and luxe carpeting in the bedroom. The condo also includes custom window treatments, built out closets and in unit washer & dryer.

title: Nicely Furnished SF Oceanfront, roommate share with pretty much just 1
description: Before responding PLEASE be sure to READ this ad in its entirety. A response asking if it is still available, or will you consider a short-term stay will not receive a response. THANK YOU!                                  San Francisco - Oceanfront share at Ocean Beach.It is a 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom fully furnished and equipped condo to be shared with a late 30’s GAM, along with his partner who will actually be spending most of the next 12 months or longer living in a secondary residence on the east coast to be closer to work. So mostly for your new roommate, we are looking for one nice LGBT-friendly person. The Ideal roommate does not work from home or bring the party home. It is a comfortable shoeless home to be shared by pretty much just the two of you who will share all of the common space.Big open living area with a fully stocked and equipped modern kitchen. There is a large outdoor, Oceanfront courtyard with a BBQ, and a gym/exercise room shared by all residents of the complex. Huge views of the beach and ocean from our Great Room Windows. Bicycle room storage is available. One assigned parking garage spot is available at a $100 monthly cost if needed. We do have an in-unit Washer and Dryer for added convenience.We are Oceanfront between La Playa Street and the Great Highway just a stone's throw from Safeway. Muni Service is out front for the 5 and the 5R (Rapid) heading downtown. Soon to be back in service again (hopefully) will be the 31, the 31AX (express) to downtown, and the 18 headed towards Stonestown. Our neighbors are the Golden Gate Park, The Sutro Dunes, Sutro Heights Park, Sutro Baths, and Lands end. We are surrounded by the best natural beauty that San Francisco has to offer.Available is your bedroom (pictured here), and what will be your own adjacent full bath at a cost of $1575. Your bedroom has a full-sized closet, a flat-screen TV and a work/cafe table with 2 chairs. There will be a PG&E and a Comcast High-Speed WiFi 50/50 share with no other costs or anything to be contracted for. All 3 of our TV’s including the larger living room one, get free, over the air TV, and or use your Chromecast or other streaming devices as you like.It is not the cheapest roommate share, but likely one of the best! What sets this share apart is how nice and comfortably furnished every room is, and how much space there is to be shared by pretty much just the two of you easy to get along with roommates. This roommate share has just come available. Preference is given to a long-term roommate share situation. Although there is not a dog living here now, a roommate who does have one, already house trained, might be considered. So if interested please send just one detailed email and then we can chat over the phone to avoid all back and forth emails.Great beach weather is coming. If you like beach volleyball or surfing, or just want to live oceanfront in San Francisco, this is the spot for you. Life at the beach is better!  Enjoy!

title: Suitcase ready-Modern furnished-equipped-Location, Quiet and Inclusive
description: Available July 1st is this Modern-Fully Furnished and Equipped true 1-Bedroom - Inclusive!Enjoy living in the best part of SOMA with unheard-of Peace and Quiet!Great location Folsom near 4th Street.The Condo sits nicely in the back corner of the complex away from the street noise.It is a very quiet unit - perfect for getting a good night’s sleep!Walk to Westfield Mall, Union Square, Muni, and Caltrain.Just a 2 or 3 block flat walk to the Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, and the Metreon.Whole foods is ½ a block away and Zero Zero Restaurant is right across the street.Target is just 2 blocks away. Keep the window treatment open 24/7 with great privacy.An In-unit Washer and Dryer is all yours.Parking not included, E-Z to walk everywhere so a car is not needed here.Available no later than July 1st with a 1-year agreement or longer with further extensions possible.Shipley Square is a non-smoking community and no pets, pleaseAt $3100 this Furnished and Fully Equipped Condo is all-inclusive. You won’t need to contract for anything. High-Speed Comcast Wi-Fi Internet service is super fast and included.  It takes just one very detailed email from a qualified applicant that leads to a brief back and forth, question and answer phone chat, to determine if a good fit may exist for all. Simply put I am not into any back and forth emails. Thanks for your interest and we are soon ready to schedule COVID-Safe in-person viewing appointments for pre-qualified individuals. This one has it all and so it always goes quickly. COVID pricing has it at $3100 down from the pre-covid $3900 pricing. Fully vaccinated individuals, go to the front of the line. Suitcase Ready-Unpack and hit the ground running or pick up your feet and relax.  Rob.

title: PRIVATE YARD! Modern, Newly remodeled, in Nob Hill
description: This large one bedroom is a brand new construction with modern design combined with a large private yard. The unit is truly high-end in every respect with tall 9 feet ceilings and beautiful private backyard. Nice view of the city including the new SalesForce tower. The apartment was completely remodeled with the latest and most modern appliances and tastefully decorated and furnished with the best quality of construction materials. In the heart of San Francisco and prestigious Nob Hill neighborhood, one block from Grace Cathedral, Huntington Park, and Cable Car. This newly remodeled unit is modern but it is inside a beautiful Victorian apartment building. The apartment has hardwood floor, a remodeled kitchen, and marble tiled shower with excellent water pressure. The setting of this unit is very cozy with lots of light. New Double pane windows combined with away from street, makes it very quiet!As a trending neighborhood, nearby vibrant community embraces the old and the new. The streets are dotted with upscale boutiques, top rated restaurants, corner bars & swanky lounges, historic theaters and hip nightclubs, as well as ethnic eateries and coffee shops. Great around the corner local market with great deli offering as well as top grocery brands such as Trader Joe's and whole food. The Financial District, Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, and the Convention Center are within walking distance. Fisherman' s Wharf, Ferry Building, Giants stadiums are all accessible with a short ride on Cable Car or city busses. This location is an optimal home base from which to explore the city without any traffic or transportation headaches. Bart provides train service to the entire Bay Area including San Francisco and Oakland international airports. The building does not have on-site parking, but parking spaces are currently available in the numerous Nob Hill garages within a block or two. Zipcar vehicles are parked in special zone in front of the building. Brand new high end washer and dryer on the same floor.Rental TermsPricing and availability are subject to change:-Rent; $3,350-Security deposit: $3,500-Available: Immediately

title: 2-E | AVAILABLE NOW!
description: The Linden1807 Linden St, Oakland, CA 94607Welcome to the Linden - A Brand-New Living ExperienceBuilt new this year, The Linden sits at the epicenter of Oakland’s vibrant arts, music, and culture community. Comprised of six 3-story townhouse communities, each with five studios and a spacious central lounge and kitchen, The Linden will have you immediately feeling at home, immersed in thoughtful design that is equal parts functional and inspiring. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood just six blocks from the iconic Fox Theatre and the legendary nightlife of Broadway, the Linden provides the ideal location for a walkable commute during the week, whether you’re headed to downtown Oakland or to San Francisco via BART, and convenient access to everything downtown Oakland has to offer. Although you’ll be greeted by a warm community that champions inclusion and individuality at The Linden, you’ll always have the freedom to retreat to your studio, which is appointed with everything you’ll need for a standalone studio experience, including a private full bathroom.Additional features at The Linden:The HEPA filters installed in each common area  reduce unhealthy particulates and provide clear, clean air no matter what is going on outside.Free Kitchen Box at move-in. We’ve curated a collection of all the kitchen essentials to help you make the most of the main kitchen and your private kitchenette. Valued at over $100, it’s another small thing we’re doing to make for a seamless move-in experience.Lightning Fast Wifi & Cable TV. All community members have unlimited access to our super-fast Wifi, and all studios have been pre-wired for included cable TV for those yet to cut the cord. Independent Heating and Cooling.  Run a little hot or a little cold? Each unit has its own dedicated thermostat, so you can keep the temperature of your space right where you want it.Washer Dryer in Townhouse. Each townhouse has a premium washer and dryer for your use, 100% free of charge. Flat rate, all-inclusive community access fee. With energy-efficient appliances and green building construction, our space uses much less energy than a conventional building in the Bay Area. To pass that benefit along to you, we have combined all utilities and services, including weekly common area cleaning, into a low flat rate of $95 per month. We value flexibility, so you have options for everything:Furnished or unfurnished spaces. All of our studios come furnished, with a queen-sized mattress, couch, and TV that compliments the space perfectly. However, if you prefer to bring your own things with you, we’re happy to provide you with a blank slate to make your own. Please note: if you are planning to bring your own mattress, our in-studio embedded bed frames accommodate queen size mattresses and we ask that you wrap it in a mattress protector prior to moving in.3- 6- 12- or 18-month lease terms. Everyone’s situation is different, so we’re offering flexible lease terms to accommodate wherever you are in life. Optional Linen Packages. Our linen boxes have you covered. The kit consists of a high-quality set of high thread-count bedsheets, a queen-size blanket, two pillowcases, two towels, and a set of washcloths, available in standard ($75) and premium ($125) sets. Click the link for more details.A conventional security deposit or small monthly fee. Cost of moving to a new apartment stressing you out? Don’t worry, we have partnered with Obligo, a service that allows you to forgo the conventional security deposit in favor of a small monthly fee. Keep your money in your pocket, and when it comes time to part ways, we will bill any move out charges to you directly. Simple!Optional in-suite cleaning.We’ve partnered with a premier hospitality cleaning service to take great care of all common spaces and, for a small monthly fee, can pop into your studio and tidy up for you every week.Early move-in accommodation program. A perk of a new construction building: as long as you pay your move-in fees, you can collect your keys up to 30 days in advance, on us!Sounds great! How do I check out the space? Swing by www.squareone-living.com/the-linden and schedule a tour, or give us a call at  show contact info. Our in-person tours are always safety-first and socially distanced, but we’re also happy to do a virtual tour on your video conferencing software of choice! We’re available starting August 15th for pre-leasing tours from 9 am to 6 pm, Monday through Saturday. Additional Links Website: www.squareone-living.com/the-linden    Virtual Tour:https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=YmBBRuAnnRdVirtual Video of Unit Common Area:https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=oUaPfLxVq1NAbout those pets…Out of respect for our community members, we are not allowing pet applications at this time. If you’ve got a furry friend, sign up for our newsletter @ squareone-living.com/keepintouch and we’ll update you if anything changes, or when we launch a new building!You’re a great fit for our community if…You value an inclusive community of individuals with diverse backgrounds and perspectives.Your total monthly household gross income is greater than or equal to 3-times the monthly rent (2.5-times the monthly rent when current debt obligations are considered) and you can provide proof of income in the form of a pay stub, offer letter, or bank statement. In certain extraordinary circumstances, we are willing to re-evaluate our underwriting and credit score requirements. Please do not hesitate to give us a call if interested.You have no prior evictions.You have a clean rental history.You purchase renters insurance and have proof of coverage prior to leasesigning.Pricing ExplanationThe listed rent of the suite is $1352 and is the average effective rent paid for our A1 Suite on a 14-month lease term, with a base rent of $1619, and including rent credits for 2 months base rent. Rent price and promotions are subject to change. Discounted pricing available on approved applications only and contingent upon enrollment in AutoPay. Household income requirements are based on 3-times market rent, or 2.5-times market rent once debt obligations are factored in. Any mention of “studio” in this ad is solely for illustrative purposes, as each individual suite is legally considered 1 of 5 bedrooms of a legal dwelling unit referred to as a townhome above. Utility reimbursements are part of a community fee and will be a fixed rate during the initial term of your tenancy.Office HoursMonday thru Friday09:00 AM - 06:00 PMContact Info1807 Linden StOakland, CA 94607P: show contact infoEqual OpportunityFederal law prohibits housing discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, familial status, or disability.

Nestled in a quiet neighborhood just six blocks from the iconic Fox Theatre and the legendary nightlife of Broadway, the Linden provides the ideal location for a walkable commute during the week, whether you’re headed to downtown Oakland or to San Francisco via BART, and convenient access to everything downtown Oakland has to offer. Although you’ll be greeted by a warm community that champions inclusion and individuality at The Linden, you’ll always have the freedom to retreat to your studio, which is appointed with everything you’ll need for a standalone studio experience, including a private full bathroom.Additional features at The Linden:The HEPA filters installed in each common area  reduce unhealthy particulates and provide clear, clean air no matter what is going on outside.Free Kitchen Box at move-in. We’ve curated a collection of all the kitchen essentials to help you make the most of the main kitchen and your private kitchenette. Valued at over $100, it’s another small thing we’re doing to make for a seamless move-in experience.Lightning Fast Wifi & Cable TV. All community members have unlimited access to our super-fast Wifi, and all studios have been pre-wired for included cable TV for those yet to cut the cord. Independent Heating and Cooling.  Run a little hot or a little cold? Each unit has its own dedicated thermostat, so you can keep the temperature of your space right where you want it.Washer Dryer in Townhouse. Each townhouse has a premium washer and dryer for your use, 100% free of charge. Flat rate, all-inclusive community access fee. With energy-efficient appliances and green building construction, our space uses much less energy than a conventional building in the Bay Area. To pass that benefit along to you, we have combined all utilities and services, including weekly common area cleaning, into a low flat rate of $75 per month. We value flexibility, so you have options for everything:Furnished or unfurnished spaces. All of our studios come furnished, with a queen-sized mattress, couch, and TV that compliments the space perfectly. However, if you prefer to bring your own things with you, we’re happy to provide you with a blank slate to make your own. Please note: if you are planning to bring your own mattress, our in-studio embedded bed frames accommodate queen size mattresses and we ask that you wrap it in a mattress protector prior to moving in.3- 6- 12- or 18-month lease terms. Everyone’s situation is different, so we’re offering flexible lease terms to accommodate wherever you are in life. Optional Linen Packages. Our linen boxes have you covered. The kit consists of a high-quality set of high thread-count bedsheets, a queen-size blanket, two pillowcases, two towels, and a set of washcloths, available in standard ($75) and premium ($125) sets. Click the link for more details.A conventional security deposit or small monthly fee. Cost of moving to a new apartment stressing you out? Don’t worry, we have partnered with Obligo, a service that allows you to forgo the conventional security deposit in favor of a small monthly fee. Keep your money in your pocket, and when it comes time to part ways, we will bill any move out charges to you directly. Simple!Optional in-suite cleaning.We’ve partnered with a premier hospitality cleaning service to take great care of all common spaces and, for a small monthly fee, can pop into your studio and tidy up for you every week.Early move-in accommodation program. A perk of a new construction building: as long as you pay your move-in fees, you can collect your keys up to 30 days in advance, on us!Sounds great! How do I check out the space? Swing by www.squareone-living.com/the-linden and schedule a tour, or give us a call at  show contact info. Our in-person tours are always safety-first and socially distanced, but we’re also happy to do a virtual tour on your video conferencing software of choice! We’re available starting August 15th for pre-leasing tours from 9 am to 6 pm, Monday through Saturday. Additional Links Website: www.squareone-living.com/the-linden    Virtual Tour:Virtual Video of Unit #1D:https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=bK2E2f9NmW2Virtual Video of Common Area:https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=oUaPfLxVq1NAbout those pets…Out of respect for our community members, we are not allowing pet applications at this time. If you’ve got a furry friend, sign up for our newsletter @ squareone-living.com/keepintouch and we’ll update you if anything changes, or when we launch a new building!You’re a great fit for our community if…You value an inclusive community of individuals with diverse backgrounds and perspectives.Your total monthly household gross income is greater than or equal to 3-times the monthly rent (2.5-times the monthly rent when current debt obligations are considered) and you can provide proof of income in the form of a pay stub, offer letter, or bank statement. In certain extraordinary circumstances, we are willing to re-evaluate our underwriting and credit score requirements. Please do not hesitate to give us a call if interested.You have no prior evictions.You have a clean rental history.You purchase renters insurance and have proof of coverage prior to leasesigning.Pricing ExplanationThe listed rent of the suite is $1477 and is the average effective rent paid for our A1 Suite on a 14-month lease term, with a base rent of $1969, and including rent credits for 2 months base rent. Rent price and promotions are subject to change. Discounted pricing available on approved applications only and contingent upon enrollment in AutoPay. Household income requirements are based on 3-times market rent, or 2.5-times market rent once debt obligations are factored in. Any mention of “studio” in this ad is solely for illustrative purposes, as each individual suite is legally considered 1 of 5 bedrooms of a legal dwelling unit referred to as a townhome above. Utility reimbursements are part of a community fee and will be a fixed rate during the initial term of your tenancy.Office HoursMonday thru Friday09:00 AM - 06:00 PMContact Info1807 Linden StOakland, CA 94607P: show contact infoEqual OpportunityFederal law prohibits housing discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, familial status, or disability.

title: Nice 12x12 room in big, comfortable 4BR/3BA home - Available now!
description: Hey everyone! Hope you’re all enjoying the transition to a (mostly) post-COVID San Francisco summer. We have a room *now available* for move-in, in our 4 bed / 3 bath two-story house in the Excelsior/Portola neighborhood, OR for move-in as late as July 1st or any date in between (we're flexible). We're looking for the right person to join our lovely and pleasant house!THE ROOM:- roughly 12’ x 12’, with one corner of the otherwise-square room “cut off” diagonally to accommodate the entry door- on the second floor, where most of the house’s living areas and bedrooms are located- attractive hardwood floors (as with the rest of the second floor)- lots of AM and afternoon sun, as the windows face Felton Street to the south/southeast- large closet/storage space, approx 4’ x 4’ in size, which is in addition to the room measurements described above- No private bath, BUT the main bath is shared with only one other person as one of the other upstairs bedrooms has its own bathroom- Note that the pictures of the room here include the departing tenant’s furnishings, which they will be taking with them, so the room will be totally clean and clear for your belongingsTHE HOUSE:- 4 bed / 3 bath, 1600 sq.ft. The house was remodeled maybe ten years ago now so everything feels relatively contemporary, which is often not the case for apartments or homes for rent in San Francisco- *Lots* of common living space, which includes a large living room area, dining room, and sizeable, pleasant, and full-featured kitchen- The main bathroom (which this tenant would use, sharing with one other housemate) is pretty large, nice, and clean!- Pretty hardwood floors- Relatively recent/new-ish appliances - fridge and freezer, electric stovetop cooking and convection oven, microwave, dishwasher (not always a guarantee in SF), large sink with built-in garbage disposal, and most importantly… WASHER AND DRYER in the garage. No more saving quarters for laundry! We even have a printer for everyone's use. No, we didn't think we'd need one either, until we did.- Some nice couch potato amenities: gigabit fiber wireless internet (I believe this is the fastest home internet available in SF), Google TV/Chromecast, Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, etc.- 2 car garage, which unfortunately isn’t available for parking as we rent it out to friend of the house J so that he can use it to work on his car occasionally, which also reduces all of our rents a little bit (this is already factored into the rent listed below). Some storage space is still available in the garage. Anyway, don’t worry about parking though, because…- Street parking is free and relatively plentiful. Those of us with cars basically never have problems parking directly outside the house.- Cute backyard patio area with lemon tree, apple tree, and gas grill for BBQing and hanging out outside when the weather is nice- We are on top of a big hill, so we have a *great* view of Bernal Hill to the north with Downtown SF peeking out behind, and the SF Bay to the east. On a clear day you can see all the way to Oakland and spot the loading cranes in the Port of Oakland.- Sorry, no pets =(THE NEIGHBORHOOD:- A pretty residential area, with a couple schools in the area, on the border of the Excelsior and Portola neighborhoods in San Francisco.- Very close access to the 280 and 101 freeways - maybe 5-7 minutes for each?- *One block away* from an entrance to John McLaren Park, which is the second largest park in SF and features several great walking routes, picnic areas, sports and recreation courts, and scenic views of the city. Being so close to such a big, nice park was a real lifesaver during the pandemic lockdown, and is still really nice now!- Two corner stores within a seven-minute walk, one of which is very well known for its excellent deli sandwiches and extensive beer, wine, and spirits selection- The SFMTA 54 bus line stops half a block away. Get to Mission St. and Geneva Ave. in 8 minutes, and to Balboa Park BART in 10-12.- The SFMTA 44 bus line stops 3 blocks away. Get to Mission St. and Silver Ave. in 5 minutes, or Glen Park BART in 10 minutes. Also useful to getting to the western part of SF, Golden Gate Park, etc.- Nearest major commercial corridors are Geneva Ave near Mission (the closest), the stretch of Mission St. through the Excelsior and Bernal Heights, and Glen Park (near Glen Park BART), all relatively close.THE HOUSEMATES:- Two guys (R and B) and one lady (M) in their 30s - B and M early 30s, R late 30s.- Master tenant (that's me, R) works in an administrative position for the University of California system. B recently retired from a long career as a ballet dancer but still teaches dance, and is involved in choreography and other related creative pursuits. M works in an administrative position for a biomedical company.- We are all pretty low key, chilled out, and respectful, and are happy to hang out together on occasion or chat about house stuff when we need to (though generally this is pretty rare). Back in the Before Times we all had very different schedules and didn’t see each other very much, though the pandemic obviously changed that. R and M work from home full time now, and B does sometimes too. This may change again in the next several months depending on when our offices open up again. Though we do see more of each other now, this house is big enough that it hasn’t been an issue at all. Remarkably, we have had basically no issues all being stuck here under quarantine - it has been a surprisingly pleasant past year given everything else going on.- We would very much like to keep it that way with the new housemate! We are ideally looking for someone who is more-or-less in the same mind state about group living as we are and is looking for the relaxing and comfortable kind of living situation that we have created here.COST AND OTHER IMPORTANT INFO:- Rent: $1,220/month. Rent is due to the master tenant by the 5th of each month.- Deposit: $1,200 due at signing. Less than one month’s rent, sweet!- Amount due upon lease signing: $1,220 (first month's rent) + $1,200 (deposit) = $2,420- Utilities generally around $125-150 per person per month. These include water, gas and electricity, trash, recycling, and compost, and and fiber internet.- Term: the new tenant would sign a month-to-month sublease with me (R), the master tenant. We are definitely looking for someone who is interested in staying for the long term, but if it doesn’t work out for whatever reason, you won’t be locked into a year-long lease.--That’s about it for the house info, so I’ll close by reiterating that this is a *very* nice, comfortable, well-equipped house (a real house, with all the amenities) - in a good location with cool and low-key housemates that are easy to get along with and will mostly stay out of your hair. The pandemic hasn’t been easy for any of us, but I think all of us here have been very happy that things have gone so well here over the past year and a half, at least as far as the house is concerned. And as things start to open up again, it’ll be great to get back to “normal” a little more. The room opening up is a great opportunity for someone who is looking for a new place to live that would value this kind of environment.If you’ve read this far and think that this might be the room for you, please email me to tell us a little bit about yourself, what your lifestyle is like, what you’re looking for in a living situation, your job/financial situation/ability to pay rent on an ongoing basis, etc. Just click the big "Reply" button at the top of this listing to get in touch. If we feel you are potentially a good match, we will get in touch to set up an interview/house tour. While we can provide an initial “virtual” tour for good candidates who are planning on moving here from out of town, we *will* need everyone else to visit the house in-person to give us a chance to meet you, check out the room and house yourself, and demonstrate that you’re serious about your interest, before we make any decisions. We are all now fully-vaccinated, but can wear masks during house visits if you prefer. Sorry for the hassle, we just think this is an important part of ensuring everyone’s compatibility and making sure you’re serious about the room.Anyway, please feel free to email with any questions about the room, the house, or any of us - I will try to respond ASAP! We are looking forward to meeting you, and offering the room to you if we think you’re the right person. Thanks!

title: Marine Unit
description: Experience resort-style living in this updated single level waterfront unit. The open floor plan offers a flowing common and dining area with a fireplace. Mirrors in the common and dining areas accentuate the light and reflect the water.

title: +BonusRoom House/1BA/Pets Neg./Yard/W&D/Nice!*ByAppt*
description: **SEE BY APPOINTMENT**"PLEASE EMAIL US YOUR NAME AND CONTACT TELEPHONE NUMBER AND WE WILL BE IN TOUCH WITH YOU AS SOON AS POSSIBLE."JUST ON THE MARKET AND LOCATED ON THE 900 BLOCK OF RUSSIA AVENUE IS A NICE, SPACIOUS TWO BEDROOM (WITH BONUS ROOM) HOUSE/HOME WITH TWO-CAR PLUS GARAGE AND A BACKYARD. ***Two Bedrooms (with  hardwood floors) ***One Bonus Room that can be used as a Sleeping area (has closet and window), a  functional Home Office or a Nursery, etc.)***One Full Bathroom with nice light***Pleasant Kitchen with  Refrigerator (new), Stove, Chef-type Stove Top, andContemporary Grey, Wood-themed Flooring***Living Room with a decorative Fireplace (with Hardwood Floor)**Dining Room with elegant Chandelier and wall Sconces with Hardwood Floor)***Large 2-Car Plus Garage (with Good Storage areas)***Washer and Dryer (located in Garage Area***Pleasant Backyard Area***Cats and Dogs (Negotiable) ***LEASE TERM--Home/House is available to Lease--terms to be negotiated between client and owner.NOTE/POSSIBLE FUTURE OPPORTUNITY: If you're looking to possibly buy a home in the future, the Owners may opt to sell the home/house at some point after the agreed rental lease term has been met.THE HOME/HOUSE IS LOCATED IN THE EXCELSIOR DISTRICT--WHICH BORDERS THE CROCKER AMAZON DISTRICT.About the Area: The Excelsior district is a neighborhood in San Francisco that borders the Crocker-Amazon district.  The Crocker-Amazon and Excelsior neighborhoods benefit from some of the most varied weather in the city, with a balance of sun and fog.  The top of the neighborhood boasts outstanding views of downtown San Francisco in the gap between McLaren Park and Twin Peaks.  Crocker-Amazon Park borders the neighborhood to the north.  It has four playgrounds and recently renovated and lighted soccer and baseball fields.  Transportation:The area is well-served by public transportation.  MUNI routes 14, 44, 52, 8X, 8BX, and 54 serve the Geneva Avenue corridor and the 43 bus also serves Geneva Avenue, as well as Naples, Cordova, and Munich Streets.  During rush hour, the Balboa Park Bart Station is only about a five-minute drive, an eight-minute bus ride, or a 15 to 30-minute walk.  The neighborhood is convenient to nearby Interstate 280, and to the Alemany Boulevard thoroughfare.  Crocker-Amazon is served by two elementary schools, Guadalupe and Longfellow.

It is a place filled with good food, art, and a lot of history and landmarks with never ending places to explore. Some very close-by conveniences include Dolores Park, BART, and many great restaurants and bars. Known as the Latino quarter of San Francisco, The Mission has always been home to different ethnic and socioeconomic groups. It covers a very large area and its busy streets are lined with used-book stores, thrift shops and produce stands, as well as Vietnamese restaurants, Spanish tapas bars, taquerias, and upscale California eateries. title: Noe Valley Charmer. Newly Remodeled-Private Deck-In Unit Washer/Dryer
description: Looking for long term tenants with excellent credit and steller references. Situated on a tree lined street in the heart of sunny Noe Valley. This apartment exudes warmth and charm with high ceilings unlike your typical in-law. The inviting open floor plan is perfect for gatherings with family and friends, and with windows at every turn-this home is bathed in natural light. Enjoy cozy moments, read your favorite book on your private deck adjacent to the modern eat-in kitchen with stainless steel appliances.The bedroom is roomy and bright with windows and a wall to wall closet. Newly re-designed bath with a glass walkin in shower and plenty of storage and beautiful slate marble design tile throughout.Noe Valley is a picturesque neighborhood that is located almost directly in the center of San Francisco. Thanks to adjacent Twin Peaks, it is sheltered from the coastal fog and winds that tend to blanket the rest of the city, giving it a unique microclimate that is warmer and sunnier than many other districts. Easy walk to gems that Noe Valley has to offer with nearby shopping and eateries, and just blocks away from the Noe Valley Recreation Center & Park and public/tech transportation - making it perfect for care-free urban living.Rent: $3650 with 1.5x for deposit. title: Urban Oasis Victorian Loft! Hardwood Flrs-Deck-Yard-Views-Parking
description: Available now. FIRM on price. When you walk into this home, you can’t help but be surprised. In the sunniest part of the City, Potrero Hill, you’ll find this truly a one-of-a-kind home. (where) Here, award-winning California Architect, Karyn Shore, transformed the upper levels of a typical 1895 Victorian into a jaw-dropping, two-story, industrial loft. Designed unlike any ordinary seismic upgrade, the living room is surrounded by a steel box frame beam with trusses above; handmade flat work and frosted glass railings and an art deco inspired spiral staircase leading to the large loft space above. Since this Victorian towers above it’s neighbors, the main floor is afforded with tall original windows on 3 sides that let in plenty of light. The living room is expansive with window views to the west and sunsets and a 25 foot peaked ceiling with aero fan, opening up to the loft. The adjacent bedroom has original pocket doors, antique light fixture, built in bookcase and period wood trim and picture rail. The main floor bathroom is bright and features detailed hexagonal-tiled floor, blue glass ‘waterfall’ chimney, black porcelain toilet and sink, with full-size tub/shower combination, featuring modern Dornbracht and Hans Grohe fixtures.Upstairs, this large carpeted space is perfect for an in-home office, with an en suite powder room, cedar-lined storage closet, and large walk closet the width of the house at the back. Operable skylights flank the sloped ceiling to let in light, fresh air and views toward the south. But the piest de resistance is the floating diamond plate seating area under the dormer, held up by a cast iron ionic column below. The views from this contemplation corner are expansive to the south and west.Towards the back of the main floor, the dining room opens up to a brand new, renovated kitchen featuring a decorative tiled fireplace and all-white modern hi-gloss cabinets and caesarstone square edges countertop and backsplash with a built-in 20 bottle wine cooler frigidaire. The modern stainless steel farm sink has a goose-neck faucet with braided cable pull-out spray and air-button activated disposal. The high-tech, multi-level Zephyr hood tops the 4 burner/1 griddle Frigidaire gas free-standing oven. The Fisher Paytel stainless steel refrigerator/freezer flanks the entry to the Pantry, with a new Whirlpool stacked washer/dryer machine towards the back and plenty of space for storage.There is a private ‘patio’ off the Dining Room and the back stairs lead to the spacious shared backyard with lush plants, a giant yucca ‘tree’, flowering bougeonvilla vine, vegetable box, stone path and the main feature - a large multi-level deck with a beautiful italian marble outdoor dining table and chairs and heater, planters and a lounge chair area on the lower deck - the perfect place to sit and relax with a cup of coffee or a glass of wine, watching the sunset.This is truly a unique and extraordinary home for those that don’t want to live in an ordinary flat. Impress your friends, live in this open, peaceful 5 star hotel-like loft!Rent: $5600Deposit: 1.5x rentParking: 1 outside parking space front of garage on street or $300 for private.Tenant: Garbage, electric, internet/cable and 1/3 waterOwner: Water/sewer, gas, alarm, landscape maintenance*Sorry no pets.Gigi Ferrozzo for private showings. gigi.ferrozzo @ avenue8 (dot) com  show contact infoAvenue 8 BrokrageCA Realtor| #02038427 *Due to COVID-19, we are having limited showings.*Masks required(Agent for Owner) believes all information contained herein to be correct but assumes no legal responsibility for the accuracy, any errors, or any omissions

You have the Third Street T line streetcar, you have the express bus that goes downtown, and you can drive four different ways to downtown. Parking is easy here compared to most of the city. No permit needed to park on the street! To go anywhere else, there are many bus lines within walking distance that will take you to virtually anywhere in the cityWho lives here You have your own private bedroom downstairs (ground-level). I, the owner, live upstairs if anything is needed at anytimeWhat do you getA completely renovated bedroom all to yourself. Ideally located, our apartments in Dogpatch, San Francisco, mix contemporary fixtures with stylish details and modern floor plans for an unrivaled experience.Created from the start with your well-being in mind, our pet-friendly studios, one, two, and three-bedroom homes wrap you in comfort from the moment you step inside our gated community. Floor-to-ceiling windows flood the rooms with natural light. The residence features diagonal planked wire-brushed Siberian Oak wood floors in the living area, unlacquered brass hardware throughout, and a Cloud White carpet in bedrooms. The custom kitchen offers Studio Becker Ash Molina Cabinetry, polished white slab Carrara marble countertops, Waterworks fixtures, Sub-Zero integrated refrigerator, and a Bertazzoni range. The luxurious, spa-like bathrooms feature chevron honed-finished olive porcelain floors, custom vanities with polished white slab Carrara marble countertops, custom brass, and casted-glass sconces, and Waterworks fixtures. One car valet parking, storage, and wine locker. Enjoy the 2,500 of the gym, steam room, outdoor heated pool, spa, and the famous Uncle Harry at the penthouse level.

title: HUGE Bedroom steps from Dolores Park for Rent
description: Stunning bedroom opening up steps from Mission Dolores Park, available JULY 1! $1950/month.This spot has all the amenities you could ask for in a prime location in one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in SF!Room:- Spacious room with bay windows (largest of the 3)- Faux fireplace, built-in floor to ceiling shelving-  Lots of natural light, space for desk/multiple dressers- Your own half bathroom, walk-in closet-  6 months or longer term tenants ideally Apartment:- Steps from Mission Dolores Park (seriously) - 3 bedroom, 1.5 bathroom, 1500 sq ft- Backyard with string lights, char broil grill, and a lemon tree- Laundry room with in-unit washer/dryer- Large living room with turntable & bar area- Sleek remodeled kitchen with dishwasher, gas stove top/oven- Utilities & high speed Wifi ~ $40-50/ month- No pets/no smokingLocation: - Convenient location in the Mission District- Quiet, well-lit side street (not a through street so very little traffic/street noise). - Easy commute location (2 min walk to J line/muni, 10 min walk to BART, blocks away from tech shuttle stop).- Around the corner from the iconic Light House by Dolores Park. -  Steps from lively bars/restaurants on Valencia Street. - Street parking can be competitive on weekends with proximity to the park but easy during the week. Roommates: Two guys mid-20s from Colorado, working in tech. Geek out on skiing, rock climbing, music, and cooking. During the week, we are both fairly busy with work and hitting the gym/intramural sport leagues. On weekends, we occasionally have people over and hit the park, but keep it clean and respectful. My roommate and I are stoked to meet people and set up times to see the apartment in person or virtually! Feel free to reach out. Thank you!

title: Corner End-Unit, Views, W/D, Parking, Doorman
description: A luxurious sun-filled corner condo in the highly desirable boutique association of 199 New Montgomery.  Wonderful layout with large separated bedroom suites, 2 bedrooms and 2 full baths, numerous spacious closets, open kitchen/living room concept design, walls of windows to take advantage of the San Francisco city views.  Dark wood kitchen cabinets with natural stone countertops, a dishwasher, stainless sink and appliances.  Beautiful hardwood floors flow from the entry into the living/dining areas and kitchen.  One master bedroom suite, large bathroom with tile, stone countertop vanity, and spacious closet.  The second bath features a tile shower over tub, granite vanity and is conveniently located near the second bedroom and living areas.  Additional condo features include large entry closets, an in-unit washer and dryer, black-out blinds in the bedrooms and privacy shades in the living areas, windows open to allow fresh air.  The boutique condo building offers a 24-Hour doorman, secure building features, side-by-side parking garage, bike rack storage, attractive lobby for guests plus a rooftop deck with a BBQ area, fire pit and lounge chairs to take in the amazing city skyline views. Excellent South of Market location within walking distance of Financial District, Yerba Buena, Embarcadero plus world-class restaurants at your doorstep. Conveniently located near the SF MOMA, Art Academy, BART, MUNI, and the best of San Francisco. Lease includes a one-car secure garage parking space and one garage storage closet. The owner / HOA pays for water and garbage services. The tenant expenses include PG&E, phone, internet, cable entertainment costs and move-in/out fees.  One-year lease, available late June 2021.  HOA pet restrictions, specific dog breeds and size restrictions.  Easy to show by appointment.

title: Studio with sleeping loft in landmark Victorian Art Complex
description: Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness. Studio with separate sleeping loft.  $1780 (single occupant rate). Studio + separate bedroom . $2080. (single or double occupant rate). Security deposit = 1.75 rent with good credit. College students with parent co-signers ok. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places. National Register #75000473San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian façade and birdcage elevator. The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage. Janis Joplin lived in the building in the early sixties, as did Wes Wilson,  the artist who created the first Psychedelic posters for the musical events at the Avalon-Family Dog and Fillmore-Bill Graham venues.New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on 2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck. Non-smoking building. Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby

title: Charming Victorian Garden Apartment
description: $3,200 2 Bedroom Charming Victorian Garden ApartmentADDRESS: 7A Chenery Street, San Francisco, Upper Noe ValleyRENT: $3,200AVAILABLE: OPEN HOUSE Sunday, June 6, 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. or by appointment. 3D TOUR: Please paste into your browser  https://my.matterport.com/show/?m=A6G6Q8xc3orABOUT 7A CHENERY STREET Beautiful, recently renovated 2 bedroom, 1 bath Victorian garden apartment with owner quality vintage detailing in prime Upper Noe Valley location. Totally renovated with concrete foundations, seismic improvements, and updated electrical and plumbing systems. Around the corner from many shops, restaurants, Upper Noe Rec Center/Playground, public transportation, Google and Apple shuttles stops and near the entrance to HWY 280 &101. AMENITIES-First floor flat with east and west sunlight -2 Bedrooms with closets -Living Room with large closet -Hardwood oak floors throughout / hex & subway tile in bathroom -Radiant (hydronic) heat throughout, including tile floor in bathroom! So toasty! -Beautiful handcrafted glass cabinets & Marble counter top in eat-in kitchen-New Dishwasher -Vintage Occidental Deco gas stove -Claw foot tub with Oak Trim-unusually deep! /Shower overhead.-Vintage Deco light fixtures -Shared Washer and Dryer - Shared  garden with brick patio and lots of hummingbirds -Beehive, Meyer lemon and apricot trees-Water and garbage included -Street parking, no permit required -Sorry, No Smoking or Pets -Public transportation just steps away, J-Church, 24 Divisidero, -Glen Park BART is an easy 15 minute walk -Apple and Google shuttles pick-up just around the corner -Close to HWYs 101 and the 280 entrance -- only one red light (and it's a right turn) -Upper Noe Valley Recreation Center nearby-- tennis courts, indoor and outdoor basketball court, baseball field and playground. -Around the corner at 30th and Church Streets there are numerous shops and restaurants including the newly re-opened and excellent Church Street Produce, the wonderful butcher shop, Baron’s Meats,  and a nail salon. Additionally you will find La Ciccia an upscale Sardinian restaurant, Cafe XO, Toast, Henry's Hunan, and Regent Thai restaurants. Wi-Fi, Dish TV in bedroom and living room. Great backyard is shared. Good closet space. Close to Safeway, Fire Station, Golden Gate Park, Ocean Beach, Zoo, Beach Chalet, Cliff House, Public Transportation. Great for traveling nurses. Close to UCSF, VA hospital, Mt. Zion, St. Mary's, and more. All UTILITIES INCLUDED 3 MONTH MINIMUM

title: FULLY FURNISHED garden unit in the Marina
description: This fully furnished, quiet, charming garden flat in the heart of San Francisco's Marina District has the perfect location to experience the city while living in a safe neighborhood that's close to everything (with a walkscore of 93!) Two blocks from the historic Palace of Fine Arts and a 2 minute walk to the heart of the neighborhood - Chestnut Street. Short walk to the sandy beach at Crissy Field to enjoy open space, jogging trails, and views of the Golden Gate Bridge.Upgraded finishes throughout, private entrance and two closets. Lots of natural light and french doors off the master lead out to a beautiful yard with rose bushes, hammock and a grill. Shared washer dryer in the garage. Heat, water, garbage and landscaping included. This is the owner's beloved childhood home so the building has been well maintained and every detail has been done with care.This unit is fully furnished (itemized inventory available). Move in date is flexible first week of July. No smoking. Sorry no pets. $2995/month and $2995 security deposit due upon signing a lease.Neighborhood: The scenic Marina District, on the city's northern shore, is known for its upbeat bars and restaurants. Fort Mason, a former military base, is a multifaceted arts complex and event space. A connected grassy park, called Marina Green, has a running and bike path and expansive views of Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and yachts on the water. The Palace of Fine Arts, dating back to 1915, is a neoclassical landmark.Public TransportationUnion Square is 15 minutes away from the property by car or taxi.The Moscone Center is 15 minutes away from the property by car.Fisherman's Wharf is 15 minutes walking distance.The SFO Airport is 15.4 miles away from the property: By car or taxi: 30 min.GroceriesTrader Joes   401 Bay St, San Francisco, CA 94133Safeway   15 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123

title: Newly Built Contemporary 3-Level 3BD/2.5BA House w/ Patio & 4 Car Pkg.
description: SUMMIT 800- Large Contemporary 3-Level 3BD/2.5 Bath House with Private Patio Garden & 4 Car Garage - $6,800.00 per month315 Summit Way, San Francisco, CA 94132FEATURESBedrooms: 3Bathrooms: 2.5Parking Spaces: 4Year Built: 2017Garage Size: 4 CarAgent Name: SusiePets Allowed: Cats & DogsEat-In Kitchen: 1Rear Garden Patio: 1Family Room: 1Living Room: 1DESCRIPTION315 Summit Way is a Spectacular newly constructed modern and contemporary single family home offering residents a calm oasis just outside the confines of San Francisco. Located in the Western part of San Francisco and approximately 8 miles from downtown central business district. There are 3 shopping centers within 1.5 mile radius or approximately a 5 minute drive!This can be your sanctuary for Lake Merced living. This single family home offers the elusive balance of open space and cosmopolitan activity. You'll take in the lifestyle of the city but leave all the limitations of San Francisco behind. So, when your day is done, you'll pull into the spacious 4 car garage, hit the button and walk into a place that's different from the start.Attractive exterior design choices create a stunning and varied landscape. Spacious volume ceilings in living, family and dining room. Large open floor plan, comfortable family room with entertainment center and quality Andersen windows surrounded by inspiring millworks. Stylish Therma-Tru front door with stylish, architecturally coordinated Schlage® handleset. Private rear garden patio for outdoor enjoyment year-round!Designer Interiors with Luxury Features. Large master bedroom suite with large walk-in closets. Rich crown molding at living room and dining room. Ceramic tile flooring in the foyer, kitchen, powder room and secondary bathroomsMagnificent Kitchen with beautifully crafted cabinets with granite slab countertops with 6” granite backsplashes in kitchen and well-appointed kitchen cabinetry provides abundant storage. Superior Viking® appliances including double convection oven, gas cooktop, microwave, dishwasher—all in modern stainless steel designs, Kohler Smart Divide stainless sink with Delta pull-down Arctic stainless faucet and Pre-plumbed ice maker line for refrigerator.Sumptuous bathrooms with elegant Kohler® tub and separate ceramic tile surround spa-like shower with clear glass door. Powder room with pedestal or cabinet vanity sink. Dual sinks with Piedrafina solid-surface vanity countertops, elegant Delta® Brizo faucet, Piedrafina tub/shower surround and countertops and Kohler tub.All interior 4-Car garage is drywalled, textured and painted.Full gutters around perimeter of residence. Please call, text, email, or reply to this post with any questions or to schedule a viewing. title: PACIFIC HEIGHTS -Pet friendly Vallejo Apartments available for rent !!
description: Located in the heart of Pacific Heights neighborhood, Vallejo Street Apartments is excited to offer newly remodeled apartment homes with hardwood floors.The building has an accessible rooftop with 180-degree views of the SF Bay, Alcatraz, Telegraph Hill and so much more! Thoughtful and meticulous attention to detail was used when planning and executing the remodeling of these beautiful apartment homes.No pet rent, No pet deposit•	Two Large Bedrooms•	Two Full Bathrooms•	Stainless Steel Appliances •	Ample Closet Space•	New Hardwood Floors•	Large Private Balcony•	Assigned Parking Available at $200 a month•	Rent-controlled building•	Pets Allowed – Limit 2, Breed Restrictions/Weight Limits apply•	Elevator Building•	Doorman in service•	Professional Management on-site•	Maintenance on-site•	$45 Application fee per adult applicant •	Deposit Only $2000 with approved creditA little more about Pacific Heights:The Pacific Heights neighborhood delivers commanding views of the San Francisco Bay and the city below, with neighborhood hills rising from the Marina and running along an east-west ridge between the Presidio and Van Ness Avenue. When Hollywood wants to film a chase scene, Pacific Heights is where it comes for cinematic thrills. Within blocks to coffee shops and restaurants. Luxury gyms and fitness studios such as Equinox, Soul Cycle, Barry's Bootcamp are close by Lyon Street steps and Presidio National Park for running or playing a round of golf are a couple blocks away. Neighborhood Highlights:-Local parks include Alamo Square, Lafayette Park & Alta Plaza Park-Dining options include Sweet Maple, Presidio Kebab, The Progress, A16, Cool Cravings, Shake Shack & Rose’s Cafe-Short drive to Safeway, Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods, Mollie Stones, Lucky & Bi-Rite Market-Local bars include The Pig & Whistle, Black Horse London Pub, Murphy’s Pub & The 500 Club-Short drive to Golden Gate Bridge, Crissy Field, Lombard Street & Coit Tower-Schools in the area include Stuart Hall, Town School & Hamlin-Local gyms include Equinox, Crunch Fitness, 24 Hour Fitness & Hit Fit SFTransportation:-Short drive to freeway 280 & 101-Walking distance to bus 22, 1, 20, 45 & 49Our property has a Walk score of 99%, It’s a Perfect Pied- a - Terre !!!We are conducting socially distanced tours. Please call, email, or text.https://www.vallejostreetsf.com/

description: Furnished, flexible month-to-month private room rental. Share a spacious flat in the Inner Richmond district of SF with one covid-safe housemate. I tend to not use the living room or kitchen as I am generally not a homebody and I don't cook.If you are a very cool, clean and respectful person (you know who you are) and think you would make a good addition to the household, then please send me a few lines about yourself and we'll talk. I have included a phone contact number - I do not have voicemail set up but please feel free to reach out via text as I only check emails once a day. title: Stunning and rarely available top floor 2BR VIEW unit in classic SF mi
description: Situated on the North side of sunny Potrero Hill with endless views to the west encompassing Twin Peaks, a glimpse of the Golden Gate Bridge, and downtown.The unit and the building have been sensitively updated and maintained with pride.The sunny kitchen has been updated with new cabinets and superior appliances. The backsplash was *just* re-tiled with vintage / original dimensional tiles from 1955, to conform with the original style of the building. There's a sunny balcony off the kitchen.Windows have been replaced with double pane windows, and insulation has been added throughout the unit for heat efficiency and sound improvement.The bathroom has a Porcelanosa tile floor and been updated with new fixtures and cabinets. The shower surround was just completed using CLASSIC HEATH TILE in keeping with the original feel of the building.Master bedroom has the western view and overlooks a community garden.Both bedrooms have good size closets, recently updated with shelving.The view from the living room is expansive and open. Living room just updated with recessed overhead lighting.There is ample storage in the unit including built in linen closet and a good size coat / hall closet.Shared laundry facility in the building, and additional storage and work space available as well. Recently developed "rooftop retreat" is available, as is shared work / project space in the basement.Parking for one car, with storage is available.Conveniently located to both the 101 and 280 freeway, and walking distance to both the Mission District and the shops and restaurants of Potrero Hill and Dogpatch.This is a small 4 unit, owner managed building subject to the rent control ordinance of San Francisco. Pets considered on a case by case basis. Certain breeds restricted.Reply via email w/ contact info to schedule virtual or in person viewing.

title: Beautiful 3- 4 bedroom home plus 1 bedroom in-law near Precita Park
description: This two level 4-5 bedroom house is located on the desirable North Slope of Bernal Heights in a quiet cul-de-sac, just 1/2 block from Precita Park. Main LevelOpen floor plan creates a loft-like space. Great for roommates or a large family. There are two bedrooms and two additional rooms that can be used as bedrooms, living rooms or offices.Freshly painted, hardwood floors, high ceilings, large windows and Victorian details throughout.The spacious eat-in kitchen has a countertop island, ideal for gatherings. Stainless steel appliances, Bosch dishwasher, Samsung gas stove. The tiled bathroom has a bathtub with shower.Upper LevelThe in-law is a separate1 bedroom, 1 bath with a private entrance where you can be secluded but share the amenities of the house. It has a large private deck that overlooks the garden planted with mature fruit trees. A picture window frames a beautiful view of Bernal Hill. The tiled bathroom has a vintage claw-foot tub with shower. Additionally, there’s a walk-in closet.The kitchenette is equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, sink and original built-in cabinets.GardenA lush garden with an expansive flagstone area is ideal for BBQs and entertaining or simply enjoying nature.GarageThe garage is a 900sf space which has 1-car parking, plus driveway parking. The laundry area has a LG washer and dryer, an industrial sink. There is ample built-in shelving for storage and space for an indoor gym or other activities.NeighborhoodExcellent location with walk score of 91. Just steps to Precita Park and a short hike to Bernal Hill Park. Minutes to Harvest Hills Market, Los Yaquis and Precita Park Cafe. Close to shops and restaurants on Valencia and in the Mission. Easy commute to Silicon Valley, 5 minute walk to tech coaches.Masks please. Thank you.To set up a viewing please contact by email or phone

The property is in an extremely well-maintained building located on a quiet, tree-lined upper Noe Valley block. Features of this wonderful unit include:		garden unit in a very private setting away from the street in a quiet 3-unit building		hundreds of exotic plants creating a very lush setting in a tropical oasis		garden featured on the Noe Valley Garden Tour		hardwood floors throughout		high end Euro-style galley kitchen with granite countertops, ceiling and cabinet LED lighting, top of the line appliances and service counter with Bistro lighting		hall bath with Neo-angle shower (no tub) with pan to ceiling granite surround and Euro-style shower door and handle		Master bedroom suite with soaking tub, floor to ceiling Italian porcelain tiles and tub to ceiling granite surround, huge walk-in closet and secondary closet. Bedroom size 13'6" x 11'		2nd bedroom is 10' x 9' with custom Elfa closet system which eliminates the need for a dresser helping maximize the space. This room will also work well as a home office or child's room being that it is smaller		3rd room can be used as a living room or a 2nd master bedroom suite adjacent to the garden and is as large a a studio apartment, 15' x 20'. Designer master bathroom with extra wide shower pan with onyx surround, dual shower heads, and custom brushed aluminum cabinetry. This room has its own dedicated heating system due to its size		16' x 13' living/dining area adjacent to the kitchen (can be used as a combo living room/dining if the other 3 rooms are used as bedrooms)		in-unit laundry with Bosch stack unit washer and dryer		forced air heating system with individual registers in each room		dedicated tankless hot water heater for endless hot water		direct garden access / terrific outdoor space		recessed LED lighting throughout the entire unit		private entrance		extra storage space within unit		flexible floorplan - 2 bedrooms with a kitchen/dining room and a separate living room; or the 16' x 13' room adjacent to the kitchen can be used as a combo dining/living room and the other 3 rooms can be used as bedrooms (including 2 master suites and a small room best used as an office or child's room)		only 4 blocks to 24th/Castro and walking distance to all conveniences and public transportation		$40 application fee per applicant		available now	SPECIAL NOTES:	Although it is a shared garden, it is rarely used by other residents in the building, and in many ways is an extension of the unit itself as it is on the same level. title: ONE RINCON | Remodeled Two-level 3BR/2.5BA Townhome Available in June
description: One Rincon is a luxury condo complex on the apex of the Rincon Hill neighborhood of San Francisco. Completed in 2008, One Rincon was designed by architectural firm Solomon, Cordwell, Buenz, and Associates. One Rincon soars to 60 stories and offers panoramic views of downtown, Bay Bridge, Twin Peaks, and Oracle Park. One Rincon combines the comforts of a luxury condo building with state-of-the-art amenities typically found at a world-class resort. This iconic development features fully glass exteriors, making it some of the most stylish in all of San Francisco. One Rincon is situated next to South Beach and the Financial District, and it's just steps away from the Ferry Building and all the major highway, as well as top-rated restaurants, such as Prospect, Waterbar, Epic, The Boulevard, Ozumo, and Slanted Door.Rare opportunity to live in a townhome at One Rincon Hill! Beautiful 2-level townhome features an open floor plan living room, patio, kitchen with stainless steel appliances and breakfast bar, half bathroom, and 3rd bedroom, located on the first level with amazing hardwood floors. The second level features two spacious bedrooms with soft carpet and two full bathrooms.KEY FEATURES:Year Built: 2008Sq Footage: 1,551 sqft (approx).Bedrooms: 3 BedBathrooms: 2.5 BathLease Duration: 12 to 16 monthsParking AvailableDeposit: $5,788Property Type: TownhomeUNIT FEATURES:• High ceilings; floor-to-ceiling windows• Hardwood floors throughout living space, carpet in both bedrooms• The gourmet kitchen features granite counters, Bosch and Sub-Zero appliances including refrigerator, gas oven/range, dishwasher, microwave, Del Tongo cabinetry• Lower level features a very spacious living room, the gourmet kitchen and a bedroom• The upper level contains two bedrooms with two full baths• Washer and dryer in the unit• Private patio• Two private entrances to the unitCOMMUNITY FEATURES:• 24h doorman and concierge• Fitness center with steam rooms and showers• Gourmet barbecue area• Outdoor lap pool• Access to Uncle Harry’s lounge on the 49th floor of the Harrison• Social room with full kitchenLEASE TERMS:• 12 to 16-month lease• Parking Available• Owner pays for trash, sewer, and water.• Tenant responsible for gas/electric• Application fee $42• Tenant pays One Rincon Move In/Move Out FeesLISTING AGENTS:Dunja GreenCompass, CalBRE 02038642show contact infoMilan JezdimirovicCompass, CalBRE 01975028show contact info

Residents of Nob Hill can admire scenic views of the Golden Gate Bridge, visit San Francisco’s public beaches, explore the city’s grand museums, and dine at lux restaurants and lively bars!"-Apartments.com

title: Your own Furnished BR with Bath, SF Oceanfront, Best Roommate share!
description: Before responding PLEASE be sure to READ this ad in its entirety. A response asking if it is still available, or will you consider a short-term stay will not receive a response. THANK YOU!                                  San Francisco - Oceanfront share at Ocean Beach.It is a 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom fully furnished and equipped condo to be shared with a late 30’s GAM, along with his partner who will actually be spending most of the next 12 months or longer living in a secondary residence on the east coast to be closer to work. So mostly for your new roommate, we are looking for one nice LGBT-friendly person. The Ideal roommate does not work from home or bring the party home. It is a comfortable shoeless home to be shared by pretty much just the two of you who will share all of the common space.Big open living area with a fully stocked and equipped modern kitchen. There is a large outdoor, Oceanfront courtyard with a BBQ, and a gym/exercise room shared by all residents of the complex. Huge views of the beach and ocean from our Great Room Windows. Bicycle room storage is available. One assigned parking garage spot is available at a $100 monthly cost if needed. We do have an in-unit Washer and Dryer for added convenience.We are Oceanfront between La Playa Street and the Great Highway just a stone’s throw from Safeway. Muni Service is out front for the 5 and the 5R (Rapid) heading downtown. Soon to be back in service again (hopefully) will be the 31, the 31AX (express) to downtown, and the 18 headed towards Stonestown. Our neighbors are the Golden Gate Park, The Sutro Dunes, Sutro Heights Park, Sutro Baths, and Lands end. We are surrounded by the best natural beauty that San Francisco has to offer.Available is your bedroom (pictured here), and what will be your own adjacent full bath at a cost of $1575. Your bedroom has a full-sized closet, a flat-screen TV and a work/cafe table with 2 chairs. There will be a PG&E and a Comcast High-Speed WiFi 50/50 share with no other costs or anything to be contracted for. All 3 of our TV’s including the larger living room one, get free, over the air TV, and or use your Chromecast or other streaming devices as you like.It is not the cheapest roommate share, but likely one of the best. What sets this share apart is how nice and comfortably furnished every room is, and how much space there is to be shared by pretty much just the two of you easy to get along with roommates. Occupancy is available as of June 1st. Preference is given to a long-term roommate share situation. Although there is not a dog living here now, a roommate who does have one, already house trained, might be considered. So if interested please send just one detailed email and then we can chat over the phone to avoid all back and forth emails.Great beach weather is coming. If you like beach volleyball or surfing, or just want to live oceanfront in San Francisco, this is the spot for you. Life at the beach is better!  Enjoy!

title: Lots of light! Spacious 1BR / 1BA corner unit condo in Hayes Valley
description: This one bedroom / one bathroom corner unit features two walls of floor-to-ceiling windows that look out over the center of San Francisco. It's a bright, spacious condo at the intersection of the ever-popular Hayes Valley and emerging Civic Center neighborhoods. The contemporary space features a remodeled kitchen with Carrera marble countertops and stainless steel appliances, in-unit washer/dryer, light hardwood floors, walk-in closet, custom Hunter Douglas designer screen window coverings, and is filled with lots of natural light. The unit includes access to the 9th floor rooftop, which has a BBQ grill, chaise lounge chairs, picnic tables and unfettered views of the city. In addition, the building includes an onsite property manager/door-person Monday-Friday from 9am-5pm (who safely signs for and stores your packages/deliveries!)CONDO DETAILS: 1 bed/1 bath (~900 sq. feet)No parking spot, but there are occasionally spots for rent onsiteIn-unit washer and dryerLarge floor-to-ceiling windowsWalk-in closet and a pantry (or closet for shoes/jackets/extra storage)Designer finishesStainless-steel kitchen appliancesUnit pre-wired for high-speed (100mbps up/down) Internet accessElevator in buildingShared rooftop accessFitness centerBike parkingDoor-person on staff Mon-Fri 9am-5pmNo smoking or pets allowed in unitLEASE DETAILS:Available: NowMonthly rent: $3,000Length of lease: 12 monthsMOVE-IN DETAILS: Security deposit: $1,500First and last months' rentTenant pays move-in/move-out fees ($200 each) and refundable moving deposit to property management companyTenant pays credit check fees (approx $30)NEIGHBORHOOD INFO: Hayes Valley is considered one of the most friendly, bustling neighborhoods in SF -- complete with some of the city's most established cultural offerings, popular restaurants, coffee shops, parks, shops, bars and more.  The condo is just a block from the new SFJAZZ Center, Conservatory of Music, SF Symphony, Opera House, SF Ballet, City Hall and more. Popular establishments include Zuni Cafe, Cala, Monsieur Benjamin, Absinthe, Lers Ros, Souvla, the original Blue Bottle Coffee, Ritual, Smitten and Miette. Shops nearby include Warby Parker, Azalea, and much much more. And it's a short walk to grocery stores/health food markets (Market on Market, Rainbow co-op, Nabila's).TRANSIT INFO:The neighborhood is super friendly for walkers (Walk Score: 98!) and bicyclistsHalf a block to the Van Ness MUNI station, streetcars, bus stops and a few blocks from Civic Center BARTClose to commuter shuttle stops (when they resume post-Covid :) for Google (Civic Center stop), Apple, Genentech, etc. Short walk to Twitter, Square, Uber offices (once or if when we return to offices)Access to highways 101 / 280 / 80

title: NOPA Full 1700 Sq. Ft. Edwardian Flat
description: Seldom available for rental because most have been  sold off as family homes, this well cared for Edwardian is located in the geographical center of the city, in NOPA, one of the most sought after neighborhoods, where the largest number of San Francisco's famed Victorians and Edwardians are surviving and thriving.The building is within walking distance of the many amenities offered along the Divisadero corridor, including restaurants (NOPA, Ragazza, Bar Crudo, Ju-Ni, Nopalito, Wine Kitchen, Mangrove, Che Fico, Baretta Pop Up etc.); 3 supermarkets (Bi-Rite, Falletti's, Lucky's); multiple corner grocery stores; a Sunday Farmer's Market at the DMV, and many other services and businesses that contribute to a convenient neighborhood location. There are five bus lines within a few blocks that can take you in any direction or downtown in 10 minutes.It has a well thought out and spacious, original floor plan with great storage including two 8' long closets, a walkthrough closet in the master bedroom, and a small butler's pantry between the kitchen and large formal dining room. Nice architectural features include rounded bay windows in the living room , double paned bay windows in both the dining room,  and master bedroom, double paned windows in the 2nd bedroom, hallway, kitchen and bathrooms. Additionally it has oak hardwood floors in like new condition, 2 decorative fireplaces, 10' ceilings, and period style lighting fixtures.  It was renovated and updated, but not chopped up into  smaller units as so many buildings of this period were. It has 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, with a washer and dryer in the unit, and is situated on the first floor. We have installed hot water on demand and both the stove and central heating are gas operated.This unit is a rent controlled condo, but we do not raise rents every year, providing our tenants pay their rent on time and take good care of their unit. We are responsible landlords, with pride of ownership, who value our tenants, and take care of them, as well as our building.This is a non-smoking building and we do not allow pets. 1853 McAllister will be shown by appointment only and guests must wear face masks and must be limited to 2 people. To protect the virus free environment, we ask that gloves be worn or hands sanitized before opening drawers, closets, etc. or we will be happy to do that for you.For more information call Donna at  show contact info (do not text, it's a landline) Available to view now. The unit is awaiting wooden blinds to match the floors and delivery is not guaranteed until the last week in June. Painting and touch ups are also scheduled, so the unit is not move in ready at this moment while we are showing it. A July move in date is possible.

title: OPEN SUN 1-1:15pm.Pantry,Fireplaces,Carpet,Yard/Lndry(1551 Powell)
description: 1st Floor 3BR/1BA Full Flat* $2,700/month annual lease* Pantry* Ornamental fireplaces* Shared yard* Shared laundry* Available: NowOPEN HOUSE: SUNDAY (6/6) 1-1:15pmADDRESS: 1551 Powell (masks required)First floor 3BR/1BA full flat on Powell between Green and Vallejo. Floors are carpeted except in living room, kitchen, and bath. Living room is at the back of the apartment. It has cabinets and a counter for the kitchen and connects to the kitchen and pantry. Each room has large dual pane windows in each room, plenty of natural lights, a new bathroom with a large shower, and direct access to garden/patio.The parking garage includes a washer and dryer on the premise. It is a walking distance (about 10 minutes) to the Glen Park Bart Station, about 5 minutes to the Muni J-Church line. title: Updated Condo with Exclusive Use Patio/Open Sat 2-3PM
description: Open Saturday from 2-3PM--Please Stop by!940 Duncan Street #D103| 1Bed/1Bath/Patio+1P Condo for LeaseWelcome Home! This 1 Bedroom/1Bath Condo has full and exclusive use of the attached out-door patio—Perfect for entertaining and gardening.  Other great features of this home are engineered hardwood flooring, quartz kitchen countertops, updated cabinetry, a decorative fireplace, gas heating and a dishwasher for you to use.  This condominium home comes complete with 1 garaged parking space, and full use of the HOA amenities. The common amenities of Diamond Heights Village include an out-door resort style pool heated year-round, an expanded fitness center with machines, free weights and a universal press, a remodeled wet area featuring a dry sauna, spa and private shower/changing area.  Upstairs, there’s a newly remodeled club room with a pool table, several seating areas and free wifi throughout the clubhouse and also poolside. We have a verdant, professionally landscaped greenbelt, updated to reflect today’s tastes with native and drought tolerant landscaping.  The HOA has also added a level II electric car charging station for the exclusive use of it’s residents. Glen Canyon Park, Douglass & Christopher Playgrounds, Lighted Public Tennis Courts, the new organic Community Garden, Haas Playground and the Diamond Heights Safeway Center are all within easy walking distance. Applicants will need to show proof of income 3x Annual Lease Amount. First+Last+$1000 Damage Deposit+ acceptable credit/employment/residence history= 1 year Lease.  Per Condo rules, a small companion animal under 25 lbs is permitted, but Property Manager must meet and approve animal before a lease is signed.There is no fee to apply, however upon conditional approval there will be a $30 fee paid to RentSpree.com to run Credit.  If you should see this property listed elsewhere at a lower price, it is a scam.  Please remember to NEVER send/wire money to someone unknown to you.We are an Equal Opportunity Landlord.Thank you,Charles MaderCalDRE #01351780
