title: Two Bedroom Victorian with Open Floor Plan in NoPa
description: Two bedroom recently updated Victorian residence including open floor plan which incorporates living room, dining, kitchen and area for a desk.  Beautiful vintage wood floors warm the residence.  Over-scale south facing windows and north facing window are double paned adding an unusual sense of quietness within the city.  The crown molding with 9 foot plus ceiling enhances space and light.In the kitchen area, the countertops are a composite stone which add a fresh, contemporary element to the space.  New stainless-steel gas stove, dishwasher and refrigerator raise the quality level of the kitchen.  The island is perfect for additional storage, entertainment or dining. The service closet allows for additional storage within the kitchen area.Location…Location…Location!!!This residence is located one block off hip Divisadero Street in NoPa and within a minutes’ walk to grocery stores, coffee houses and top restaurants.  Golden Gate Park is also located one block away, as well as Alamo Square Park - perfect for the exercise enthusiast.  Also within a short walking distance is a shuttle pick up for Google and Genentech.Bedroom #1 provides an abundance of storage 14+ feet and bedroom #2 provides 12+ feet for storage. Each bedroom is separately thermostatically controlled.The bathroom offers beautiful stone and a shower surround.  The shower is over 30 days.  There’s a window for fresh air, shelves for linen storage, medicine cabinet and additional drawers in the sink vanity. Also included in this unit is a European style washer/dryer combination.This unit is located on the lower floor approximately five steps to the front door of an original early 1900 Victorian.1 Year Lease $3,250 per month $3,250 Security Deposit$25.00 Application FeeNon-smokingNo petsThe owner provides water and trash.

description: SEVERAL UNITS AVAILABLE!***PHOTOS ARE OF SIMILAR UNITS IN THE BUILDING***These are SRO units: Single room occupancy. The units are private, and the kitchen and bathrooms are communal. Prices starting at $895.Structure Properties is pleased to present the newly-renovated Jackson Square Commons located at 706 Kearny Street! Modern decor paired with a prime Financial District location makes this a truly one-of-a-kind community. The new renovation features high ceilings, modern engineered flooring, vanity with granite countertop and closet storage. The building boasts a beautifully designed resident lounge that has been meticulously decorated for coziness and comfort, offering the perfect place to enjoy the company of your neighbors and friends. The shared, single-stall restrooms and showers feature bright tile and ultimate privacy. The kitchen provides new cooktops, stainless microwaves and toaster ovens and a deep sink with drying area. Jackson Square Commons is located within walking distance to Chinatown, BART, The Ferry Building and multiple major Muni lines. Also within walking distance you'll find multiple grocery options, vibrant shopping and arguably the City's best farmers market open on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. title: Two Months Free Rent!! Centrally Located, Renovated SRO! 668 Clay St
description: SEVERAL UNITS AVAILABLE!***PHOTOS ARE OF ONE OF THE LARGER UNITS IN THE BUILDING***﻿Please note, the unit is private. Bathrooms and kitchen are communal. Units come unfurnished.Welcome to the Residences at Pyramid Commons! Be the first person to live in this newly-renovated co-living space. Carefully crafted for the urbanite on the go, the Residences at Pyramid Commons strike the perfect balance of modern and cozy. Each room features freshly finished floors, new paint and a brand-new granite vanity next to a tall closet storage space. The shared bathrooms are lined with subway tile, stone countertops, new private shower stalls and modern finishes. The two community kitchens, also brand new, feature industrial cooktops, stainless steel countertops and a small dining area. The Residences are located at 668 Clay Street, nestled right between the Financial District and Chinatown. Destinations by foot are endless, with the Embarcadero and the vibrant shopping scene of Union Square just blocks away. Take a breather from all of the action by strolling the waterfront or picking up fresh produce at the Ferry Building's weekly farmer's market! Decades of culture as well as amazing food and ambiance are just steps away. The proximity to Market Street also offers plenty of public transit options via Muni Metro, Bart and Golden Gate Transit.DETAILS:-This is a non-smoking community-One year lease-No utilities included-Single room occupancy, with shared kitchens and bathrooms-Deposit equivalent to one month's rentREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Credit Score of 650+ Monthly income of 2.5x the amount of rentPositive referencesStructure Properties, Inc.100 Green Street, San Francisco, CA 94111www.structureproperties.comCalDRE# 01961414This unit is a rental unit subject to the San Francisco Rent Ordinance, which limits evictions without just cause, and which states that any waiver by a tenant of their rights under the Rent Ordinance is void as contrary to public policy.

title: Available Now-1BR/1BA
description: DESCRIPTIONThe available unit, is located in building ground-level front. The apt is a one bedroom and one bathroom, Living Room. The kitchen has granite counter tops, updated appliances(refrigerator, stove) kitchen cabinets. The one full bathroom, with a shower. The whole apartment has been freshly painted through out.Perfectly situated in the hot Inner Mission, Soma area just steps from FOODCO(Grocery Store) just 3 blocks from Best Buy and multiple coffee shops and restaurants. Multiple Muni lines are nearby and easy access to 280 and 101 Freeway. Major destinations can be reached within a reasonable amount of time from the Mission vicinity. A cab ride to San Francisco Airport runs about 30 minutes and 40 minutes by BART. AREA INFORMATIONThe Mission District of San Francisco, California serves as a melting pot of cultures and Latin-inspired cuisines. Bordered by Duboce Triangle, The Lower Haight, Hayes Valley, The Castro, Potrero Hill, Noe Valley, Bernal Heights, SoMa, and Bayview, this versatile neighborhood lies in the middle of the action. Additionally, the Mission's geographical location insulates it from fog and wind from the west, so it tends to be warmer and sunnier than other parts of San Francisco. Widely known for its Latino markets, first class cafes, upscale restaurants, lowbrow dive bars, excellent taquerias, and tasty street food, a variety of options await all who dwell in this neighborhood.Please copy below link into browser for videohttps://share.icloud.com/photos/0sX3Cv14e3spClo-QR1vp6CtA1BR / 1BA 550ft2no smoking no parking Rental Amount: $2,100/moDeposit: $2,100KEY FEATURESYear Built: 1911Sq Footage: Approximately 550 sqft.Bedrooms: 1 BedroomBathrooms: 1 BathroomLaundry: NoLease Duration: 1 Year Lease requiredPets Policy: No dogsFloor: Ground Level UnitProperty Type: ApartmentRENTAL FEATURESLiving room KitchenRefrigerator & Gas StoveGranite countertopKitchen linoleum floorCarpeted floors Cable readyLEASE TERM-Applications OnsiteOne year lease requiredWater, Garbage are included with the rentTenant pays PG&EApplications and credit report or proof of income required!Please call or email Lonnie or Ron for showing

title: MUST SEE 2BR/1BA APT. AVAILABLE NOW!
description: North Beach is that rare thing -- a neighborhood that manages to be a perennial hit with tourists, and also to remain beloved by San Franciscans. It's best known as San Francisco's Little Italy, with its high density of check-clothed restaurants, cafes and Old World delicatessens. It's also a popular pilgrimage for fans of the Beat movement seeking the old haunts of Kerouac and Ginsberg. However, North Beach is no relic, and it has much to offer beyond pasta and poetry.This vital neighborhood is home to some of the liveliest nightclubs and bars in town. Small boutiques carrying handmade clothing and imported goods dot the streets, particularly on upper Grant Avenue. Though Italian restaurants appear to dominate the dining scene, there are plenty of other good spots to try once you've had your fill of lasagna, with menus featuring Japanese, French and contemporary fusion cuisine. Many MUNI bus lines run through the neighborhood, and  gives a fast ride downtown or with just block or two away just walk! One of the best things about the North Beach is its proximity to Financial District and Peers night life. title: Great 1BR/1BA APT AVAILABE NOW! Fillmore St.
description: 345 Fillmore Street #1 is a great one bedroom apartment in San Francisco area. Central North San Francisco, which encompasses both Lower Haight Street and Alamo Square, remains home to beautifully preserved Victorian architecture, including the six homes known as the Painted Ladies, which still stand even after the 1906 earthquake leveled many homes of their kind. Located just a few miles north of Central San Francisco, this area brims with culture, art, restaurants and things to do.There are excellent bike lanes and the terrain has steep hills. 345 Fillmore Street is very bikeable, biking is convenient for most trips. The 22 bus line travels Fillmore itself, up from the Lower Haight, and down from the Marina Green. title: Now Available 2br/1Ba Apartment!
description: DESCRIPTION-119 Shotwell StreetThe available unit, is located in building ground-level front. The apt has 2 bedrooms and Living Room that separates the rooms. The kitchen has granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances(refrigerator, stove, dish washer) and brand new kitchen cabinets. The one full bathroom, with a shower with tub combination. To add to this great apt is a very large hallway walk-in closet, to store almost any and everything!Perfectly situated in the hot Inner Mission, Soma area just steps from FOODCO(Grocery Store) just 3 blocks from Best Buy and multiple coffee shops and restaurants. Multiple Muni lines are nearby and easy access to 280 and 101 Freeway. Major destinations can be reached within a reasonable amount of time from the Mission vicinity. A cab ride to San Francisco Airport runs about 30 minutes and 40 minutes by BART. AREA  INFORMATIONThe Mission District of San Francisco, California serves as a melting pot of cultures and Latin-inspired cuisines. Bordered by Duboce Triangle, The Lower Haight, Hayes Valley, The Castro, Potrero Hill, Noe Valley, Bernal Heights, SoMa, and Bayview, this versatile neighborhood lies in the middle of the action. Additionally, the Mission's geographical location insulates it from fog and wind from the west, so it tends to be warmer and sunnier than other parts of San Francisco. Widely known for its Latino markets, first class cafes, upscale restaurants, lowbrow dive bars, excellent taquerias, and tasty street food, a variety of options await all who dwell in this neighborhood.Please copy below link into browser for videohttps://share.icloud.com/photos/0aCh0yL4qikdE1-Qr35vAJquQApplications onsite and credit report or proof of income required2BR / 1BA 850ft2 available now no smoking no parking Beautifully 2-Bedrooms /1- Bathroom119 Shotwell Street, San Francisco, CA 94103Rental Amount: $2,600/moDeposit: $2,600KEY FEATURESYear Built: 1900-Vintage buildingSq Footage: Approximately 850 sqft.Bedrooms: 2 BedroomsBathrooms: 1 BathroomLaundry: Shared Coin laundry roomLease Duration: 1 Year Lease requiredPets Policy: No dogsFloor: Ground Level UnitProperty Type: ApartmentRENTAL FEATURESLiving room Large KitchenStainless Steel Appliances(Refrigerator & Stove)Dishwasher Granite countertopKitchen linoleum floorPergo Hardwood floors Cable readyLEASE TERMOne year lease requiredWater, Garbage are included with the rentTenant pays PGESmoking is not permitted on the premises.Contact: Lonnie or Ron for showing

title: Nice 1BR/1BA AVAILABLE NOW-NOBHILL AREA!
description: 1534 Clay Street#6 is nice 1Br/1Ba apartment in San Francisco, Nobhill area. This 2nd floor unit is a great apt  within walking distance to the Financial District, Union Square, Polk and Hyde Street for coffee houses, restaurants, bars and shopping.  San Francisco is to experience living in one of the most beloved, picturesque cities in the world. Rich in culture and history, San Francisco is abundant shopping, dining, theater, art, and entertainment options. It's so true! From brunch at Sweet Maple on Sunday, to Wine Maker Wednesdays at Resolute, to the nightlife literally right outside of your door with easy access to buses and cable cars to downtown, Chinatown and N. Beach. Located near the northeast corner of San Francisco, Nob Hill has some of the most beautiful architecture in the city. The neighborhood was built on one of the city’s 44 hills, affording its residents breathtaking views of the San Francisco Bay and Marin County, as well as Alcatraz and the Marina District.Locals love this Nob Hill area, a few blocks from Union Square,  Academy of Art College, walking distance to AAC, Taylor St., FIDM, Financial District, Powell St. BART, Chinatown, Aliment, Sons & Daughters, Last Drop Tavern, Beanstalk Cafe, Summer Place, Wreck Room,  Jasmin's Cafe, Golden Gate Grill, Golden Gate Tap Room & Scala's Bistro for its laid-back, small-town feeling. Many residents know each other by name and greet each other when passing by, and every day of the week feels like a casual Friday. title: The Beacon - 1 BR, 1BA Condo 814 Sq. Ft. - Panoramic View
description: South Beach - 1 BR, 1BA Condo 814 Sq. Ft. - Panoramic ViewProperty Address260 King Street, Unit #1413 | San Francisco, CA 94107  Available: 06/01/2021Offered ByGolden Gate PropertiesDescription    Located on the upper floors of The Beacon tower, this one bedroom, one bathroom condo boasts panoramic views from Twin Peaks through the downtown San Francisco cityscape and to the San Francisco Bay and Bay Bridge. The spacious floor plan is over 800 sq. ft., with an open living/dining area that has plenty of natural light. There is a well-appointed chef's kitchen with premium stainless steel appliances, custom cabinetry, and granite countertops. The bedroom also has an expansive window line with a dazzling city backdrop and features a large walk-in closet with custom organizers. The luxurious bathroom is outfitted with subway tiles and has a laundry closet with a washer/dryer. In the intersection of San Francisco Mission Bay, South Beach and SOMA neighborhoods, the Beacon is in a very convenient, desirable location, truly the heart and soul of Mission Bay. With farmers' markets at the Ferry Building and UCSF Campus, South Beach Harbor, SF MOMA, Yerba Buena Gardens, and countless restaurants and bars, amenities and attractions are all around. Caltrain and Muni at your doorstep, and easy access to the Bay Bridge, 280 and 101 freeways, and BART make transportation simple.FEATURES:•1 Bedroom•1 Bath•814 sq. ft. per tax record•Kitchen Appliances Included•Modern Sophistication and Open Floor Plan•In-Unit Washer/DryerAMENITIES:•24-Hour Doorman, Concierge, and Security•Business Center w Conference Room•State-of-the-art Fitness Center w Locker Rooms & Saunas•Heated 25-Yard Outdoor Swimming Pool•2 Outdoor Spas•Club Room with Catering Kitchen and Entertaining Terrace•Private Dog ParkSHOWINGS:***COVID-19 Showing Process***[We have adjusted our viewing process to adhere to the statewide Shelter-in-Place/Social Distancing mandate and to ensure we keep our staff, clients and the public safe during the pandemic]*NOTE* Applicant(s) Must Physically View the Unit Prior to Submitting Application(s). title: 831 Wisconsin St
description: Three bed, 1 bath upper unit located at the top San Francisco's iconic Potrero Hill. Unit has refinished hardwood floors throughout, and sweeping views of the San Francisco Bay. Grand living room and dining room face west with an abundance of natural lighting from large windows. The bathroom is recently updated and is off the hall. The kitchen is an open floor-plan, with an O'Keefe & Merritt stove, brand new dishwasher and granite counter top, natural lighting, and views of the San Francisco Bay. Unit opens up to a walk-out deck, with views of the San Francisco Bay. Unit has new in-unit washer and dryer as well.Located a block away from the Potrero Hill Recreation Center, and a few blocks up from the neighborhood shops and cafes on 20th Street. 5 minutes from highways 101 and 280, Caltrain, MUNI, and UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital.Owner pays for Water. Unit delivered unfurnished.Call or text  show contact info with interest.

title: $3,100 Huge Remodeled 1 BR Unit, hardwood floors, elevator, garage
description: NOTE: Apartment has just been vacated. It is undergoing a mini-facelift including a new paint job. It will be available for occupancy around July 1st. Close to Inner Richmond commercial areas with shopping and dining Other than its exceptional condition and the fact that there is a new structural slab (earthquake proofing), this 3 story corner building is quite typical of those built in 1926. This is a bright and spacious (about 875 sf) 1st floor corner unit; It faces the trees and lawn that borders Park Presidio Boulevard. Hardwood floors and double paned windows throughout. An entry hall and foyer imparts a sense of 1920s decadence. There are 3 closets that total about 60 sf of space. Some people have even set up a mini-office with a desk and computer in one of the larger closets. A map, at the end of the picture section, shows views from where the pictures were taken in each room.Kitchen (Pics 1, 2, 9) was updated 6 years ago; new light fixtures, gas stove, lots of cabinet space and ample counter space; a separate eating area with hardwood floors. The kitchen and adjacent eating area would be what one might find in a small house in the area.  No dishwasher or garbage disposal, but a garbage chute is conveniently located just feet from the rear (kitchen) door. Bathroom (Pics 7, 8) has original tile with a shower over tub and a linen closet; new lighting and plumbing fixtures. The other two rooms are extremely large, with new light fixtures and refinished hardwood floors. Either can be used for a bedroom, and the other for a living room or dining room. One is 15' x 17' (Pics 4, 12) and the other is 15' x 20' (Pics 3, 10, 11). Remodeled laundry facilities on the entry floor. For freeway access, it is conveniently located right across from Park Presidio Boulevard, easy access to freeways 101 North to Marin and 101 South to the Peninsula. For public transportation and the downtown commute, it is right on the California bus line, (across the street from Express stop to downtown), or one could walk a block to Clement Street (restaurants GALORE!), or another block to Geary. NOTE: Parking is an off street garage with remote control...it will cost an extra $220/month. While parking is usually available on the street during the day, it is a good idea to have a garage space.To view, call Arles during working hours at  show contact info.  But please, if you wish to move a dog into our building, DO NOT CALL.

title: Beautiful Hayes Valley 3br/2ba flat for lease
description: Virtual Walkthru available. Contact for informationA classic San Francisco 1920's style Victorian building with a 1st floor flat available for lease. Located in the beautiful Hayes Valley just a few minutes walk from wine bars, cafes, five star restaurants, high-end boutiques, clubs and bars It is walking distance to Civic Center, the Symphony, the SF Opera and much more. Its vibrant community of trendy shops, is walking distance to numerous parks, tennis courts, basketball courts and public transportation. A short walk from Hayes valley and you are atop the Hayes Street Hill, home of Alamo Square and the famous “Painted Ladies,” colorful historic Victorian homes. Walk a short few blocks more and you are in the heart of Divisadero’s vibrant community near The Independent music venue, renowned eateries, cafes and shops. Hayes Valley is a perfect centrally located place to live.     This charming Victorian has much of its 1920’s original style, and some original period details have been retained. The unit is spacious & non-smoking that boasts 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, offers ample natural light via large bay windows, 15ft vaulted ceilings and hardwood floors throughout. One bathroom features a large clawfoot bathtub. There is a generous size kitchen capable of hosting, a refrigerator and stove. The unit is unfurnished ready for you to personalize and make it a home to your exact comforts.  Unit’s Highlights Include: - 3 bedrooms  - 2 Bathrooms (one bedroom has a private bathroom w/  Claw foot bathtub & shower over tub) - Unit access to backyard and back decks) - Back decks have magnificent views of San Francisco - Large living room with decorative fireplace (non working)  - Large bay windows - Hardwood floors throughout - Roomy kitchen with ample cabinet space   - Refrigerator & oven  - Square footage is approx. 1,400 sq/ft Details: - Floors: Hardwood  - Kitchen: spacious - Outside area: shared backyard- Shared rear deck space with beautiful views of San francisco skyline - Parking: Street parking- Transportation: MUNI bus stop at the corner - Pets: no- Storage: no - Laundry: Laundry in unit - Utilities: Tenant pays PG&E (owner pays water and garbage)Additional Details- Deposit: 1 month’s rent- Credit check required- Rental history required- Verifiable Housing and Employment References - 1 Year lease Tenant Tesponsibilities: - Ability to pay rent in a timely manner  - Ability to care for property  - This is a family owned flat - Ability to assume PG&E utility bill in your name (owner pays water & garbage utilities)- Ability to coexist & respect other tenants in the building- Ability to commit to a minimum year lease- Lease arrangement: Total monthly rent is $3,750  Virtual Walkthru available. title: Remodeled Top Floor Apartment Steps from Duboce Park!

The open south-facing living room + kitchen make for a wonderful place to soak in the sun and entertain guests. Gorgeous glass paneled pocket doors separate the living room from the bedroom retreat!  The bedroom hosts multiple large closets and connects to a newly remodeled sleek bathroom.  The bathroom features a glass enclosed stall shower with dual shower heads, modern vanity with storage below, brand new light fixture above and super cool lighted mirror!  Additional features:  newly painted throughout, sparkling refinished hardwood floors, vintage light fixtures, new cabinet hardware, brand new window coverings, updated common area carpeting & paint, and a lovely shared rear garden.  Within steps to all the fabulous conveniences the HOT Duboce / Castro neighborhoods have to offer:  parks, cafe's, shopping, nightlife, and multiple fitness centers!  Run don't walk to this amazing opportunity in the heart of San Francisco! title: Huge 1740 sq feet 2br/2ba beauty in inner richmond
description: This listing is for a huge (1740 square feet!!!) beautiful 2br/2BAMarina style flat in the Inner Richmond district. It is the middle unit located on the second floor of a 3 unit building . It features gorgeous parquet floors throughout, dramatic arched doorways, large living and formal dining rooms which is perfect for entertaining, and a large eat in kitchen with chef quality appliances (Thermador range) featuring plentiful storage and cabinet space. Off the kitchen is the in unit laundry room with a newer pair of washer and dryer. Down the hall are two large bathrooms which were recently renovated. One is apart of the master suite and features new ceiling height stall shower stall , newer Toto toilet and sink. The adjacent bedroom is also spacious and leads to a north facing private deck with views of Golden Gate Bridge and Marin headlands. The shared yard sits below the deck and can be used as a large outdoor entertaining space. This unit comes with one garage spot. This unit is available 7/1/2021 or earlierPictures above were taken one year ago with previous tennant’s furnishings. Please email Andy for social distance compliance private showing

There is a very large Living Room with large bay windows, and one of the Bedrooms also includes these windows. There is a shared Laundry Room in the building plus a garbage chute too. This first floor full flat in San Francisco's Alamo Square neighborhood has beautiful hardwood floors ranging from pale to dark browns, and has simply amazing 15'+ ceilings. The back bathroom has a tall shower shower stall.You'll love the large, central kitchen which easily accommodates a dining table with room to spare. title: Large 1BR/1.5BA (1100 sq/ft)! Top Floor! Lrg Study! Views! Quiet!
description: This very large (1100sq/ft), bright and sunny one bedroom, one and a half bathroom apartment is available now. Located on California St. Between Polk and Van Ness.Top Floor unit, Cathedral ceilings, magnificent views!The building is only nine years old and everything is in fabulous condition with a modern design inside and out. Copper shingles and steel panels adorn the front of the building and the huge round bay windows give the building a sleek, sophisticated look..The living/dining room is bright, open and inviting. title: Unfurnished 1 bed/1bath
description: This unit is a quiet 1 bedroom 1 bath at the Millennium Tower. Unfurnished.Asking rent is for 12 month contract and does not include parking. The Millennium Tower is a 58-story high-rise condo building centrally located in San Francisco's south Financial District (also boarders SOMA and South Beach) at the intersections of Beale, Mission, and Fremont Streets. The development has 2 separate buildings: a 60-story tower and an 11-story podium building.Containing a total of ~400 homes, the building evokes images of a crystal with a multi-faceted facade designed to reflect sunlight at various times of the day, much like a sparkling crystal in the sky. The quality of the amenity level and service Millennium Tower provides is unparalleled in the city of San Francisco. The 20,000 square-foot amenity complex includes a massive 5,500 square foot fitness center, a children's playroom, an outdoor terrace with beautiful landscaping and seating area, a 75-foot indoor competition lap pool under a large skylight, an adjacent hot tub, a wine cellar, a tasting room, a 2,500 square foot private lounge with food service from Michael Mina's RN 74 just downstairs, and a screening room with a 100" HD projector screen to top it off.The Millennium Tower caters to the most sophisticated city dweller. title: Spacious 2bd/1ba in Inner Richmond!
description: Spacious top floor unit with two spacious and equally sized bedrooms, one full bath and a kitchen that is open to the living room. The unit faces Arguello and has lots of natural light. Laundry is located in basement, parking is included. The unit is walking distance to Golden Gate Park, Clement St. Rossi Park and to many bus lines.Unit Features:- Large and spacious- Two spacious bedrooms- One full bathroom - Updated kitchen- Laundry in building Lease Terms:- One year lease - Security deposit 1.5 x rent - Owner pays water and garbage - One car covered parking is included- Sorry, no pets - Non Smoking unit- Available now! Location:The sprawling Richmond district runs across the entire northern border of Golden Gate Park. The Inner Richmond sits above the eastern section of the park and like its neighbors, is renowned for its foggy skies and brisk weather — natural to this region in such close proximity to the Pacific Ocean.The residential streets of the Inner Richmond are lined with a variety of housing styles ranging from single-family abodes to multi-unit properties. From the sand dunes, the region emerged after the 1906 Earthquake as a heavily residential district with long strips of commercial offerings. Some of the original family-owned storefronts remain intact today alongside homeowners whose families have called the Inner Richmond home for more than a century.The Inner Richmond is notable for its many authentic Chinese restaurants. You can also find a number of other cultural cuisines represented along Clement Street including Burmese, Thai, Vietnamese, and Korean foods as well as a variety of produce markets.Similar to other large districts in San Francisco like Noe Valley or the Mission, the Inner Richmond has a little bit of everything to please everyone, minus the hype and high price tag. The main drags of the Inner Richmond that carry over from the west are home to destination restaurants, mom-and-pop essential stores, book stores, beauty salons, and home décor shops.The Inner Richmond is heavy in history and culture, a great place for people looking for a residential core with a big city commercial and cultural flair.Jackie Tom - Leasing Agent/Broker for Owner License # 01349629 / Broker Rentals In SF 1318 Hayes Street San Francisco CA 94117.Rental listings subject to change at any time. We especially love the spice/oil cabinet next to the dishwasher, the large storage drawer, and the pots/pan wall hanger to help save space (it's the little things). I have never lived on a city block where it seems like the neighbors care so much about the betterment/improvement of the area.... Storage - having the laundry room for storage is a huge plus."Lease Terms$3,750 / month, one month's security deposit. title: Sunny, Large Studio w/ Office/DR in Elegant Rent Controlled Building
description: This is an elegant, sunny, VERY large studio apartment in one of San Francisco’s most beautiful buildings. It has a completely remodeled kitchen and bathroom, and brand new hardwood floors throughout.  It has a separate dining room/office and a large walk-in closet. Heat, water and garbage are included in the rent. The building has new front-loading washer and dryers, a video surveillance system, and a full-time, onsite manager. It is quiet and secure. This building has been placed on the San Francisco Historical Registry. It was constructed in 1911 and is one of the City’s most beautiful apartment buildings. It has a unique central spiral staircase capped by a stain glass skylight. The building has been owned by the same family for more than 40 years and is impeccably maintained. It is located three blocks from Union Square in the middle of San Francisco’s thriving art, theatre, and commercial district. Please phone the Resident Manager, Sean, to set up a viewing.

title: Just You & Me - Seeking 1 Housemate to Share Entire Bayview Home w Yard & Parkin
description: Interested in sharing an entire, upgraded house with just one other person? A whole fridge for just two people?  Only one other person to share the bathroom, kitchen, backyard…? Pet-friendly. Reserved parking. Backyard. Storage. Available for move-in anytime in June.The house is in sunny Bayview, it has 2 master bedrooms (12’x11’ and 12.5’x10), 1 bathroom, plus other rooms we can use however we choose – I’m thinking media room and a guest bedroom? The rent is $1800 plus 50/50 split on PG&E, water, and internet. There is also a refundable $1800 deposit. Minimum 3-month contract that can then go month-to-month at the same price if you like. My recent roommate was amazing but she moved to Colorado and then I'm just now moving into this place. I’m going to miss her.The house itself is a one-story Victorian. The ceilings are high and there’s an incredible backyard with artificial turf, a fire pit, a small shed, and an ADU-room. The entire exterior was just painted. All new stainless-steel fridge with icemaker and filtered water, touchscreen gas stove, low-profile microwave, the fanciest dishwasher I’ve ever seen, granite counter-tops, disposal, Lutron LED lighting, Nest thermostat, double-pane windows, fancy washer/dryer, tankless water-heater, security front and back doors. It’s a historic home but it’s obviously been really well-maintained and very recently upgraded. Your room could come furnished if you like (or not). Similarly, I have most if not all of the furnishings we need (couches, vacuum and carpet cleaner, plenty of art, tons of cookware and kitchen stuff, a media center, tools, lots of shelving and bookcases, etc.), but I can sell anything we end up having extra of, or anything we don’t end up needing. The T-line and 3rd St are 1 block away and CCSF is one block away in the other direction. There is easy street parking in the neighborhood for our guests but you and we have reserved off-street spots for us right in front of the house.About me:I’m in my late 30’s but have always been an old man at heart. High school teacher. Gay. I enjoy cooking. I am vegan but you by no means need to be vegan/vegetarian. I love hiking and go on frequent hikes with my dogs. I have two awesome little dachshund-mix rescues. They’re very social, quiet, and cuddly. Actually, they go to work with me every day. I put way too much of my time and energy into teaching and grading but I do love what I do. I’m fairly extroverted and social, though often less so after teaching all day. Matters of social justice, anti-racism and anti-xenophobia matter a lot to me. I think I’m fairly easy to get along with and I continue to be friends with all of my past roommates. I’m sex-positive and open-minded about most things. I don’t really work out or anything but I try to be healthy … kind of. Haha. I enjoy being around people who are different than me and around people that I can learn and grow from. What else…? I’m fairly clean especially in shared spaces though, overall, I am pretty laid back and tend to go off my roommate when it comes to chores and cleaning.About you:I think that a good housemate is a good communicator – you keep the lines of communication open about what you want and need. You’re mature, respectful, and considerate. You must love dogs - my 2 dogs are easy to love but if you just tolerate dogs then this might not be the best match for you. Let me know if you have pets and we can talk out the logistics, but I’m very open to it. If you are LGB, trans or queer, you are more than welcome. You are also very welcome regardless of your age, gender, race/ethnicity, spiritual views, or politics. Obviously, that’s legally the case but I actually mean it as well. Even if you are from a less-than-common background or you have uncommon needs, don’t hesitate to reach out. You’re of course welcome to have over dates and friends but no one should be lowkey living in the house with us. In general, just be kind, flexible, and responsible. Do your part in keeping the house clean and kept up. It goes without saying that you need to pay rent on time.If all of this sounds like it might be a good possibility for you, send me a message and we can set up a phone call or something. I’m hoping we can become friends and not just have a live-and-sleep-in-the-same-house vibe if possible – now that I think about it, my roommates and I have always become friends and kept in touch after moving on to other things.Let me know if you have any questions and good luck in your housing search.

The Flower Market Lofts at 590 6th street is an elevator building situated in a convenient location at the edge of SOMA and Mission Bay.

title: Stylish, Modern & Fully-Furnished Home Near Transit & Freeways
description: We are renting our single-family home while we are on sabbatical for a year.THE HOUSE- Recently remodeled single-family home with patio and garden, ping pong and foosball tables, sand box, and tree house.- Sustainable, all-electric construction includes solar PV, heat pump, LED lighting, ultra-efficient appliances & fixtures, greywater system, and really low utility costs!- Super modern kitchen w/island has top European appliances including: induction stove, combi oven w/steam, dishwasher, bottom-freezer fridge, toaster oven, and more- Bathroom has fully-tiled shower, European fixtures and vanity, and plenty of storage- Furniture includes queen-size bed, bunk bed, sofas w/chaise and coffee table in living room, dining table with room for eight (8), master bedroom closet, multiple reading chairs, two kids desks and dressers, plenty of toy storage, and bookshelves in most every room- Utility room provides lots of extra storage, work shop, pantry, and washer/dryerAMENITIES- All bedding, towels, linens, kitchen gear, starter toiletries and basic pantry items provided- High-speed internet & wifi (billed to tenant)- Utilities (electricity, trash, water) are billed to tenant to encourage conservation, but they are really low due to solar and greywater system- Gardener comes twice/month at no additional costTHE NEIGHBORHOOD- Located in beautiful and safe Glen Park (just south of the Mission) on a tree-lined street with multiple parks nearby- Only a few blocks up from the stores, cafes, and restaurants of Glen Park village (including a supermarket, bakery, hardware store, ATM, gym, and bar) with a Walk Score = 91- Several childcare/preschool opportunities nearby- Only a 15-minute walk to gorgeous and sprawling Glen Canyon Park, which boasts tennis courts, grass fields, playground, picnic areas, a rec center, and abundant trails for excellent hiking or mountain biking in one of SF's wildest remaining places.MOBILITY- Close to freeways (101 & 280) & public transit for an easy work commute:- Car to UCSF Mission Bay or SF State (10 min)- Car to SFO Airport (15 min)- BART (underground) to Downtown (20 min)- bus/shuttle to UCSF (20-30 min)- BART to UC Berkeley (30 min)- car/tech shuttles to Peninsula (30-45 min)- CalTrain to San Jose (1 hr)- There are also bikeshare and carshare stations next to the BART station.- On-street parking

title: 2 Bedroom apt 1.5 blocks from 24th St BART, parking available
description: We have a two-bedroom 1-bath apartment available for rent in an awesome location in the Mission.2ND-FLOOR APARTMENT IN 2-UNIT VICTORIAN:- Gas range, refrigerator, garbage disposal, and dishwasher- Bright open plan living/dining/kitchen area- Monkeybrains internet with symmetric upload/download speeds- High ceilings with overhead lighting in each room- One full bath- Bedroom closets have built-in shelves, bigger room has walk-in closet- Laminate flooring throughout, except for tile in bathroom- Hallway closet with ample space for storage- Washer and dryer in unit- Central heat- Garage below, another unit above- Sorry, no yard accessTRANSIT:- Less than 5 minutes walk to 24th St BART- One block from Mission Street, easy access to Muni buses 14, 14R, 49Note there is an extra connected room, which has its own separate entrance from the outside, that is not part of the rental. Landlords will use this room starting Fall 2021 at the earliest as a home office, and won't enter the rest of the apartment unless you request repairs, etc. or for other reasons allowed by law for non-emergency purposes, in which case you'll receive at least 24-hours notice. The door to this room will be lockable from both sides for mutual privacy and security.UTILITIES:- Internet ($35/month) - The unit has its own electric and gas meter. Bill to be paid by you directly to PG&E. - Water and garbage is combined for the building so it will be split 50/50 between two units. GARAGE:There's a tandem garage space available separately for $250/month. By tandem, we mean: it's a single long garage space where two cars can pull into. We'll share spare car keys so if both cars are parked and the inner car wants to get out, the inner car's driver can move the outer car out of the way first. When driving into the garage, nobody should have to move any cars because the first car to arrive will always take the inner spot.AGREEMENTS:Please:- Respect quiet hours 11p-8a- No cigarette (even e-cigarette) smoking inside or around the home. - No waterbeds, candles, or animals in the home. A quiet cat might be okay.- Avoid wearing shoes at home when people are upstairs. Neighbors upstairs don't wear shoes so it'll be quiet for everyone.- Don't paint, add adhesive or put holes (e.g. nails) in walls.- Follow signs on compost, recycling and landfill bins.- Don't sublet or Airbnb.- Avoid keeping doors open unattended for personal safety and pest prevention.- Don't store things in the garage level except for one bike per person.$ DUE WHEN SIGNING LEASE:- First month's rent - prorated if if move-in date is after the 1st of the month- Security deposit of $1,500 plus last month's rent- We may run a background check in which case we will need to charge $40 per person (the cost for the background check)LEASE: Month-to-monthRENT CONTROL:This is not a condo, so it is rent-controlled and rent increases are limited - this limit varies from year to year but generally it's under 2%.POC and LGBTQIA people welcome!_______________________________________________________OPEN HOUSE:We'd like to meet everyone who'd like to live here. So please have all roommates RSVP ideally by the day before the open house you all would like to attend, even if you're coming at different times: https://calendly.com/lei-jess/15min?month=2021-06 _______________________________________________________APPLICATIONS DUE JUNE 7: https://forms.gle/JmuaF6veDbfgfoaV9

title: 2 bds 1 ba with a Bonus Room as Home Office

PG&E, water, and garbage collection are charged additional $95 per person per month. Non smoking. $500 per pet fee with no more than 2 pets. Credit Check and Proof of Income are required.

title: Spacious Studio Apt in 1910s Edwardian building - #21
description: This charming studio is located in the happening Lower Polk district, right in downtown San Francisco.  A walker’s haven, within a two block span there are numerous restaurants, bakeries, cafes, grocery bodegas, CPMC Van Ness Campus, the Great American Music Hall, and more. SF City Hall and Civic Center is a half mile away (10 min walk). Union Square, and the famous Powell Street, is 0.6 mile away (12 min walk). Public transportation is also readily available right from the apartment. The 38 and 19 bus lines are on our block, and connect you to Market street, Financial District, the Bay Area Transit Center, Marina district, or Richmond district. The 47 and 49 lines are just another block further on Van Ness. We’re also a 15 minute walk from the Civic Center BART and Muni train station (or hop on one of the many buses to connect you there).- Spacious studio apartment in an Edwardian stone building from 1912- Central downtown SF location- Tall ceilings and large windows- Hardwood floors- Spacious closets and plenty of storage space- Steam radiator- Full kitchen and full bathroom- Coin-operated washers and dryers in basement- On-site Community Manager- Non-smoking unit- No pets allowed- No parking included, but there is street parking and parking garages nearby- Tenant pays for all utilities (water and garbage billed through Livable)- Rent is $1,550 per month, online, mailed, or dropped at the office just a few blocks down Van Ness- Rental application and a $1,650 move-in deposit requiredViewings by appointments only -- send a request through the email associated with this listing. title: NoPa Light-Filled Top Floor Apartment
description: Hello!Light-filled 1-Bedroom/1-Bathroom on top floor of NoPa residential building available on June 15, 2021. Deets below.Apartment:- 1-Bedroom, 1-Bathroom apartment in NoPa, ½ block from the Panhandle- West-facing unit on 3rd floor (top floor) with large windows in bedroom, living room and kitchen. Dreamy light at all times of the day (heaven for plant peeps)- High ceilings, ample storage throughout apartment (coat AND linen closets)- Large bedroom can fit Queen-size bed and dresser + couch and small desk if you’re WFH- Walk-in closet with a skylight, built-in shelving and overhead storage (could double as small office if you want to be creative!)- Windows have been replaced within the last three years - good insulation and street noise reduction- Water heater was replaced within the past year and functions great- Kitchen has a gas range, great cabinet space and a dishwasher (!)- Trash chute in kitchen and all bins (waste, recycle and compost) in basement. Bins taken to the street by the building on Sunday nights- No laundry in the building, but there’s a laundromat with app-based pay options a block away - or there’s always Rinse :)- Cat friendly- No smoking in the unit- Landlord stays out of your hair but is attentive if/when there are issues- Landlord is diligent about annual alarm and fire escape checks for safety- Tenant responsible for PGE & Internet/Cable - Rent and Lease Terms: 1-year lease @ $2,975/month. There could be an option to go month-to-month beyond a year (landlord to confirm)Neighborhood:- A stone’s throw away from the Panhandle (a godsend during the pandemic)- Easy commute to UCSF- Walkable neighborhood with great staples: grocery stores (Lucky’s and Gus’s), corner stores (Home Service Market), coffee shops (Central Coffee, Karma Cafe, Sacred Grounds, Starbucks), bars (Bistro Gambrinus, Barrel Head), etc.- Haight Street bars & restaurants 3 blocks south and Divisadero bars & restaurants 5 blocks east...perfect stumbling distances to be in the mix but not IN the mix- Street parking options available- Bus lines within 2 blocks: 21, 43, 5, 5R- Bus lines within 4 blocks: 6, 7,7x buses and the N line (but let’s be honest, you’re going to take an Uber anyway)FB tech bus picks up at Fell & Masonic (I think the others stop nearby too)Please let me know if you have any questions and I’ll be happy to answer them for you. If you want to see the place, we can make arrangements for a tour (masks please). If you’re interested in pursuing a lease, I’ll connect you with the landlord and you can fill out an application, provide references, financial info, etc.It’s been lovely living here and the only reason we’re leaving is because we had an opportunity to take over a friend’s lease in a larger space. We would highly recommend this unit!

title: ~ 2 bed / 1 bath ~  Noe Valley ~ Backyard ~ W/D in unit ~ Location ~
description: Location: 3891A 25th St. San Francisco, CA 94114Contact: Ben  show contact infoVIRTUAL TOUR (Copy/paste): https://youtu.be/XtjRr3bXYH4Description:This quiet duplex apartment is on a tree-lined block. Noe Valley is a quaint, in-demand place to live. The neighborhood features tidy rows of Victorian and Edwardian homes, and thanks to surrounding hills, has some of the city’s sunniest weather. Stroller pushers and dog walkers jostle along 24th Street, which is stocked with bakeries, wine and cheese shops and relaxed cafes. A weekly farmers' market is held in the modest town square. One of the attractions of Noe Valley is that the adjacent Twin Peaks partly blocks the coastal fog and cool winds from the Pacific, making the microclimate usually sunnier and warmer than surrounding neighborhoods.Traffic flow is limited – one main north access through Castro Street to Eureka Valley, one main west access up Clipper Street toward the former Twin Peaks toll plaza and west of the city, several east accesses to the Mission District through 24th Street, Cesar Chavez, and other numbered streets, and the main north–south Church Street access used by the J Church Muni Light Rail.Public transit includes the J Church, which runs down Church Street until 30th Street. The 24 Muni Bus also runs through Noe Valley. Its route comes from the north on Castro Street and switches to Noe Street at 26th Street. It then exits the neighborhood via 30th Street. Additionally, the 48 Muni Bus runs down 24th street, connecting the neighborhood to the nearby Mission District. The neighborhood is primarily residential, although there are two bustling commercial strips, the first along 24th Street, between Church Street and Diamond Street, and the second, less dense corridor along Church Street, between 24th Street and 30th Street.This apartment features the following:1st floor unit\Fully remodeledHardwood floors throughoutGranite CountertopStainless Steel refrigerator, stove, microwave includedForce air heatingWasher and Dryer in unitBackyardPlenty of cabinet space and storageBath with tub/shower comboBeautiful TileModern fixturesEasy street parking with SFMTA permit.This is a non-smoking unit.Details:Floors: HardwoodKitchen: Standard - Electric / GasLaundry: In UnitParking: Street with SFMTAUtilities include: NonePets: No Pets.Rental Terms: 12 monthsRent: $4295.00 + UtilitiesAvailable: ImmediatelyApplication Fee: $25.00 per applicantSecurity Deposit: $4295.00 OACLocation:3891A 25th St. San Francisco, CA 94114To Apply:Online applicationCopy of each applicant's drivers licensesProof of income: Last 3 months of paycheck stubsCredit check$25.00 Application fee per applicant over the age of 18Please contact:Ben  show contact infoEqual Housing Opportunity Provider

title: Not the cheapest-Just the best San Francisco Oceanfront roommate share
description: This is a really great San Francisco Oceanfront roommate share opportunity for one.You will have your own comfortable furnished bedroom and private full bathroom.You will share all the common space in this furnished and equipped 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom Oceanfront condo here in San Francisco at Ocean Beach.Mostly you will share the entire home with just my partner because I will be headed to the East Coast for likely a multi-year work situation. Your room will be available for move-in on or before June 1st. Your roommate will be a late 30’s GAM who does not work from home. Ideally, you would also be employed and not working from home and looking for a long-term opportunity. To keep the home relaxed always, we are not looking for any sort of heavy drinker or someone who will bring the party home. The home is shoe-free, drug-free, and of course LGBT friendly. We are dog lovers without a dog these days and so if you have a well-trained dog yourself then we will be happy to meet your four-legged friend.  I hope to head east myself for work in the area of July 1st or possibly sooner.This is an awesome spot with easy muni bus service heading to downtown San Francisco and elsewhere. Safeway is just about across the street and we are surrounded by the best of San Francisco’s natural beauty, the Golden Gate Park, Ocean Beach, Sutro Dunes, Baths, and Park, not to mention Lands End with all the bicycle and hiking trails right here. If you are a surfer dude then even more perfect for you. Quality of life is everything. Even our In-Unit washer and dryer (no coins needed) is a convenient plus. 1 dedicated parking spot will be made available to you at a cost of $100 per month. Outside of the $1575 rent, you will only share a 50/50 split of PG&E Electric (actual usage only) and a 50/50 split of the Comcast High-Speed Wi-Fi where your cost is just $30. That is it there are no other costs as all else is included.One detailed email will lead to a fast response via a phone call if it looks like you read this entire ad and it looks like a good fit may exist. If the ad is up then it is available and so without a detailed email, there will be no response given. It’s pretty much one relaxed guy looking for one relaxed roommate who is also responsible, respectful, and super easy to just get along with.Enjoy always, life is sweet here at the beach in San Francisco!   Whoops! I almost forgot to mention that we have use of a private 24/7 gym/exercise room, a bicycle room, and a large oceanfront community courtyard overlooking the ocean and the beach!

title: Gorgeous 2-Story Architectural Home w/ Bay Views
description: Enjoy a view of the bay that is comparable to the finest views in the Marina District and Cow Hollow, but for a fraction of the price!603 Main Street, Sausalito CA 94965!This charming Gingerbread Victorian 2-story main house at 603 Main Street in Sausalito, known around town as "The Pink House, is available for rent.  One of the members of "The Kingston Trio" rented this home for many years in the 1960's.Conveniently located in the southern end of Sausalito in its most desirable neighborhood called "Old Town", it's only 4 blocks to the bay and a short walk to picturesque Bridgeway Blvd (which runs along the Sausalito waterfront), the corner market, the waterfront restaurants, and the ferry to downtown San Francisco (takes 25 minutes).  Old Town is so close to the Marina District, Cow Hollow, and Pacific Heights that it's practically another district in San Francisco.This architectural wonder was shipped over from Europe in the 1800's, by a ship captain on his ship.From the moment you open the gorgeously detailed, hand carved heavy wooden front door with the ornate Victorian brass door handle, the interior reveals detailing and craftsmanship that is rarely seen in California.  This spacious home has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom, and is about 1670 square feet of space on 2 entire floors, with a water view of the bay and Angel Island from both floors and an outdoor deck.The Pink House has fancy architectural box ceilings and original period details in the living room, formal dining room and large master bedroom with walk-in closet.  Both the large living room and formal dining room feature shimmering chandeliers and tall ceilings.  The formal dining room and staircase have wainscoting decorating the walls.  There is a breakfast area off of the country style kitchen (a nod to Marin living), and a large private view deck suitable for entertaining, which looks down on a lovely backyard garden and also has city lights views of the Old Town hills and surrounding valley.As we like to say, not only does The Pink House have a view looking outside, but it even has a view on the inside when the blinds are closed.There is a washer and dryer, stainless steel appliances, and quartz countertops in the kitchen.A bike path that heads into Fort Baker, the Golden Gate National Recreation Area, and the Marin Headlands is just 3 blocks away, and hiking and mountain biking trails are just minutes away.  The Marin Headlands have stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge and San Francisco.  As you know, Marin County was the birthplace of mountain biking.  Invite your friends over to watch the Sausalito and San Francisco July 4th fireworks displays from Bridgeway, and the Blue Angels jets during the annual Fleet Week performing their acrobatics over the bay between San Francisco and Sausalito.The Pink House is only 20 minutes from the Financial District in San Francisco, and is closer to downtown than many districts in San Francisco are.  Sausalito is the first town north of San Francisco across the Golden Gate Bridge.  The Pink House is only 7 minutes drive to San Francisco.  So imagine quickly hopping over the Golden Gate Bridge to return to your bay view dream home just minutes from the bridge, in a town that people come to visit from all over the world which is often compared to Portofino, Italy.It's just 3 blocks to the Golden Gate Transit bus stop, which regularly travels to/from downtown San Francisco with free wi-fi aboard all buses.You can experience one of the world's most magnificent commutes every day on the ferry across the bay to the Ferry Building at the foot of Market Street in San Francisco - it also stops at Pier 41 at Fisherman's Wharf. The ferries have free Wi-fi inside, and a full bar. Imagine coming home sipping a  Chardonnay while enjoying the gorgeous sunset and the Golden Gate Bridge, and stunning views of the city and bay every day. There's nothing like the smell of clean salt air to invigorate for the rest of the day.There is a big discount for ferry commuters using the Clipper Card - $7.25 instead of $13.50.The Manzanita Park and Ride is only 10 minutes away at the north end of Sausalito next to Hwy 101, where many of the large tech company shuttles pick up their employees and take them to offices in San Francisco and Silicon Valley/San Jose.Why live in San Francisco with all of the noise and congestion, where you're fortunate to get a place with "lots of light" in a building pressed right up against the neighbors, when you can instead come home every day to your architecturally exquisite home in a world-class vacation destination with a beautiful view of the water and Angel Island, and just blocks from the bay?Experience why locals prefer the Sausalito lifestyle, and work at home, in San Francisco, or in Silicon Valley.10-month lease that hopefully you will renew. We hope that you will fall in love with the house and stay for years.Security Deposit is $6,750.Indoor cats and small dog breeds under 20 lbs and under 16" tall are ok. Subject to approval after meeting the pet.  There is additional monthly pet rent and refundable pet deposit.Water and trash are paid by the owner. Subletting and AirBnB is strictly prohibited.

title: Studios, 1Bd's and 2BD's in the Historic Alhambra Building
description: Don't miss out on this opportunity to rent an apartment in the fabulous ALHAMBRA. We have a number of lovely studios, 1BD and 2BD apartments! Prices range from $1350 - $2600. Come tour them all!The Alhambra was built, by Dunn and Kearns in 1916 (the same architects as the Alcazar Theater, Castle and the Alhambra Theater on Polk) in an Art Deco/Arabesque style after the Alhambra palace in Spain. Stunning ornate lobby, walk into your palace everyday. Steeped in history, the Alhambra penthouse was purportedly once occupied by Rudolph Valentino, the Italian silent film star.Many units have been recently renovated, hardwood floors, new fixtures and original restored clawfoot tubs. Big bright Architectural keyhole shaped windows, full of light, views of the rooftops overlooking Geary Street. Large bedroom closets. Gas stoves. In-house laundry with an "ocean view".The building has an old-school San Francisco feel with a strong community of tenants. We watch each others pets and have movie and cocktail nights in the yard. Once-upon-a-time (pre-covid) we would have magicians and bellydancers on occassion. Come experience what San Francisco is all about at the Alhambra building.Owner pays for water, heat, garbage. Tenant pays for gas and electric.There is a parking garage across the street, but not part of the building. Walkscore of 100. Friendly neighborhood market and trendy wine bar next door. Tons of restaurants and artisan bakeries nearby. Walking distance to Whole Foods, Trader Joes and the Civic Center Farmers Market.Two blocks from the New Hospital on Van Ness - Up and Coming Neighborhood full of artists and young professionals.Move-in Requirements:Excellent Credit is required.Income of at least 2x the monthly rent netVerifiable rent references - 3 year rental history with your name on the lease.Move-In Costs:First months rent + Security Deposit (1 months rent plus $500)Make an appointment to see this beautiful building today! DO NOT CALL OR EMAIL WITH SERVICE OFFERS OR OTHER COMMERCIAL INQUIRIES

title: Rarely available 2BD in Historic Building
description: Don't miss out on this opportunity to rent an apartment in the fabulous ALHAMBRA. We have a handful of lovely studios, 1BD and 2BD apartments! Come tour them all!Coveted 2BD overlooking Geary on the fourth floor of the historic Alhambra Building. Built, by Dunn and Kearns in 1916 (the same architects as the Alcazar Theater, Castle and the Alhambra Theater on Polk) in an Art Deco/Arabesque style after the Alhambra palace in Spain. Stunning ornate lobby, walk into your palace everyday. Steeped in history, the Alhambra penthouse was purportedly once occupied by Rudolph Valentino, the Italian silent film star.Apartment is recently renovated, hardwood floors, cute galley kitchen, new fixtures and original restored clawfoot tub. Big bright Architectural keyhole shaped windows, full of light, views of the rooftops overlooking Geary Street. Fairly open floor plan. Large bedroom closets. Gas stove. In-house laundry with an "ocean view".(...it's actually an amazing mural)The building has an old-school San Francisco feel with a strong community of tenants. We watch eachothers pets and have movie and cocktail nights in the yard. Once-upon-a-time (pre-covid) we would have magicians and bellydancers on occassion. Come experience what San Francisco is all about at the Alhambra building.Owner pays for water, heat, garbage. Tenant pays for gas and electric.Parking garage available across the street. Walkscore of 100. Friendly neighborhood market and trendy wine bar next door. Tons of restaurants and artisan bakeries nearby. Walking distance to Whole Foods, Trader Joes and the Civic Center Farmers Market.Two blocks from the New Hospital on Van Ness - Up and Coming Neighborhood full of artists and young professionals.Move-in Requirements:Excellent CreditIncome of at least 2x the monthly rent netVerifiable rent references - 3 year rental history with your name on the lease.Move-In Costs:First months rent ($2395)+Security Deposit (1 months rent plus $500)Make an appointment to see this beauty today! ~ It WILL NOT LAST LONG.DO NOT CALL OR EMAIL WITH SERVICE OFFERS OR OTHER COMMERCIAL INQUIRIES

title: Large Modern Studio in Beautiful Neighborhood at Lands End
description: Photographs not necessarily of vacant unit, may be of similar unit.UNIT VIEWING: Due to Coronavirus COVID-19, we are only viewing by appointment and no more than 2 people at any viewing.  Please email or call for an appointment.  Also include your name, unit number and building (El Prado) when responding.  Thanks!FOR RENT: 1 Large Studio (Unit 202), Smoke-Free in a Beautiful Neighborhood.AVAILABLE: NowEL PRADO APARTMENTS 101 Point Lobos Avenue, San Francisco CA 94121INFORMATION:Rent: $1900 per monthProperty type: ApartmentAvailable: NowBedrooms: StudioBathrooms: 1Approximate Square Feet: 600Pets allowed: Cats OnlyPet restrictions: Pet deposits range from $300.00 to $500.00Included utilities: Heat, Hot & Cold Water, GarbageRent control: YesLease: AnnualRENTAL FEATURESSMOKE-FREE UNITSHardwood Floors ThroughoutPeriod FeaturesKitchen, Wood Cabinetry and Granite CountersHigh End Appliance UpgradesMulti Custom-Cycle DishwasherSelf-Cleaning Gas RangeMicrowaveUndercounter Stainless Steel Sink and; Dual Spray Retractable FaucetLarge Walk In ClosetBUILDING AMENITIESSpanish Revival ArchitectureSecure Entry SystemOn Site LaundryBasement Garage (Parking is at an additional rent and is a separate lease)ElevatorLarge Period LobbyLandscaped GroundsBeautifully remodeled large studio in a 1920's Spanish Revival Building in the Vista del Mar/Sutro Height Neighbor of the Outer Richmond has Spectacular Spanning Ocean Views.  On a clear day, in many units, you can see all the way down the coast line to Pedro Point, south of Pacifica.  This corner unit has a large kitchen with dishwasher, 5 burner range, microwave/hood/light, under-counter sink and under-cabinet lighting.  Must see it to really appreciate it.Built in 1925, El Prado is a Spanish revival beauty that boasts some of the most spectacular ocean views in the Lincoln Park area. The restored lobby entrance leads you to spacious units flooded with natural light from large floor to ceiling windows. Private entry room, large walk in closets, newly remodeled kitchens with separate dining area. This spacious studio features classic retro elegance, period fixtures and details with all the modern conveniences. And El Prado is a few blocks from so many things to do, especially if you like outdoors and the ocean. Trails to hike and bike just are just a short walk down to Lands End and Lincoln Parks. Play a few rounds at the Lincoln Park golf course, see the latest exhibit at the Legion of Honor. Of course, you can always take off your shoes down at the beach to walk along the shore and perhaps fly a kite. For your convenience, we provide an on-site laundry. We also feature indoor parking for an additional monthly rent, but we only have a limited number and they may all be currently occupied.

title: Pay $999 for 3 MTHs! - Floor to Ceiling Windows and Our Open Floorplan
description: The Irvington show contact info1532 NE 21st AvenuePortland OR 97232Bed: 1Bath: 1Rent: 1399SQFT: 700Got some downtime and need to unwind? If you want somewhere serene to clear your head, you need look no further than our smoke-free community with long private balconies, gated off-street parking, free bike storage, and parcel lockers. Our community offers you the very best of the city from the peaceful confines of the historic Irvington and Sullivan’s Gulch neighborhoods. Our Walk Score of 87 makes us as a “Very Walkable” location and our Bike Score of 100 makes us a “Biker’s Paradise”. Rest assured, you can explore the area and nearby Portland with or without a car.If you just need to get away and enjoy the city’s offerings, explore all of the shopping, dining, and entertainment that nearby downtown Portland has to offer! We offer our residents a myriad of top-notch amenities to make life that much easier so that you have more time to kick back. Your home is your castle and a place to unwind and relax.Our AmenitiesAlarm SystemControlled Access Building EntryGated Covered or Uncovered Parking*Light Oak Hardwood Floors in All Living AreasPrivate Deck / Patio with Living Room and Bedroom AccessAll New Brushed Nickel Lighting, Fixtures, and HardwareFloor to Ceiling WindowsMaple Soft-Close CabinetsConvenient Laundry Facility in BuildingSliding Glass Patio Doors*Elevator Access to Floors 2-6FREE Bike StorageProfessionally Managed by Princeton Property ManagementWith easy access to I-84 and I-5, The Irvington is just minutes away from Downtown Portland and The Pearl District. Enjoy The Good Life... Welcome Home! Seize your chance to live in The Irvington, one of the most iconic apartment communities in Portland, OR. Live next-door to the heart of Portland’s hustle and bustle!At The Irvington, we get that life can sometimes get hectic, busy, or just downright stressful. The Irvington provides residents with roomy one-bedroom apartment floor plans with modern design and filled with closets, so you can find the home that fits your lifestyle for years to come. The Irvington offers something for everyone. See our available amenities to find something that speaks to you. Get a sneak peek of the good life here at The Irvington.

title: Excellent Location; Move-In Condition

title: Gorgeous condo in Inner Sunset
description: Lovely remodeled condo is in the move-in condition. Elegant entry leads to a spacious living room with decorative fireplace, a light-filled formal dining room, and a modern Kitchen and remodeled bathrooms. A row of windows facing the south brighten the kitchen with natural light. The kitchen furnishes granite countertops and tiled walls, gas stove/oven with pot filler faucet, wine cooler, dish washer, microwave, pull-out kitchen drawers, and plenty of cabinets. A walk-in laundry closet provides a set of newer washer and dryer and linen shelves. A remodeled bathroom with dual sinks and the shower over jacuzzi bathtub. Two large bedrooms tucked in the back. The master bedroom has a bathroom including a washbasin and toilet, and sliding doors to the back yard. 2nd bedroom has window shutters all around and a walk-in closet with organizers. Beautiful wood flooring is throughout the condo.Located closed to the heart of vibrant Irving Street, UCSF, Golden Gate Park, De Young Museum, Academy of Science, Japanese Tea Garden, public transportation (bus stop is right around the corner), shops, restaurants, market, few steps to the newly remodeled library, playground and tennis court. title: 3BD/2BA, Modern, brightly lit tri-level town-home! Yard! Garage!
description: This 3BD/2BA, modern, brightly lit tri-level town-home is located in the Bayview area very close to Dogpatch. The main level opens to a light filled formal living room, with deck and views, an updated kitchen, and a dining room with a second deck that overlooks the garden/patio. The second level has vaulted ceilings above 2 spacious bedrooms, 2 updated bathrooms, also adorned with great light. There is a third room on the lower level that opens to the patio. A large garage with interior access and room for storage complete this special property. Enjoy the open green space park, tennis and basketball courts and more all just moments away. Don't miss this wonderful home that is close to, public transportation, HWY 101/280, and much more!The home sits on edge of Youngblood-Coleman Park and offers a well-maintained tennis and basketball courts, newly remodeled soccer fields, outdoor amphitheater and tons of green for dogs to run and fetch. You are also a short walk to Speakeasy Brewery and neighborhood hot-spots like All Good Pizza, Flora Grub &; Ritual Coffee.Townhome is dog-friendly and great for your furry friendsShort walk to Speakeasy Brewery and neighborhood hot-spots like All Good Pizza, Flora Grub &; Ritual CoffeeNeighborhood has new restaurants popping up all the time recently Tato and Alma Cafe were newest additions. Several new breweries, distilleries and wine-bars have moved into the Bayview as well.Also, light walk/jog to Herons Head park with beautiful waterfront nature trailArchimedes Bathhouse also short distance from house. During the spring summer and fall Dogpatch is a short 15-20 minute walk from this home and features lots more restaurants, bars, cafes and coffee shopsNo shortage of things to do in the in the upcoming Bayview & existing DogpatchAccess to T-Line Very easy to get to SFO and interstatesEvans & Cesar Chavez gives quick access to other neighborhoods as wellONE YEAR LEASE / SECURITY DEPOSIT 1.5 TIMES RENTRENTER'S INSURANCE REQUIREDAPPLICATION FEE $30 PER ADULTDawn Cusulost.  show contact infoDRE#01142235Corcoran Global LivingVesta Asset Management, Inc. www.vesta-assetmanagement.com DRE #01869443

title: Renovated | In-Unit Laundry | Garage | Storage Closet- 1701 Grove
description: VIDEO TOUR: https://youtu.be/1zfIn5fi7_kThis wonderful apartment has been home to its owners for many years. Its been recently renovated with a tremendous attention to detail and high end finishes. A foyer space greets you, rich dark wood floors, high ceilings and classic character make a memorable first impression. The living room is charming with its decorative stone front fireplace and picturesque window seat. This room connects seamlessly to the kitchen by its breakfast bar. The kitchen is sure to please with  its custom craftsman style cabinetry, subway tile backsplash, stone counters, stainless steel appliances and window over the sink with a lovely view of the street below. Off of the kitchen is the laundry room with stacked machines and custom storage shelving and baskets for organization. Both of the bedrooms offer a great amount of space, charming neighborhood views and sunlight. Each room has sliding door closets and could accommodate a king size bed. The bathroom boasts a deep soaking jetted tub, subway tiles and modern fixtures.THE NEIGHBORHOOD:NOPAThe NOPA neighborhood of San Francisco is a peaceful destination packed with local coffee shops, quaint businesses and pretty Victorian and Edwardian homes. Located in the center of the city its sandwiched between bigger, more well-known neighborhoods like the Haight, Hayes Valley and the Western Addition, giving residents easy access to dozens of popular gathering spots and notable destinations.1701 Grove St. has a walking score of 93 out of 100 and a bike score of 99 out of 100! Living here you are within walking distance to Golden Gate Park/Panhandle, Alamo Square Park, and many great restaurants, shops, cafes and nightlife on Divisadero and Haight Street!~15 minutes to the Corporate Shuttle Stops at Haight & Divisadero and Geary Blvd. & Divisadero~Minutes from multiple bus lines! 31, 24, 21, 6, 7 & N-OWL~5 minute drive to Trader Joes Market and 4 minutes to Whole Foods Market ~9 minutes to Bi-Rite Market~Minutes to Saint Marys Medical Center, USF & Kaiser  DETAILS:Rent:$4650Deposit:$4650Bed: 2Bath: 1Lease Term: 12 MonthsWater and garbage included1 large parking spot included! title: 2 Bedrooms *Beautiful Victorian Garden Flat, avail. July 1st, $2,400.
description: Hi!   Please see photos that hint at this inspirational living environment, inside and outside.There are two rooms:  156 sq. ft., and 210 sq. ft. in this three bedroom flat.  Finely furnished. (see photos) All personal items will be gone, including the piano.  The rooms have closets, tall windows that let in good light, chandeliers, and are quiet.  One bed and a couple chairs can be gone, too.  I am thinking that one of the two available rooms could be an office or music studio.  As the flat has all wooden flooring, acoustics for stringed musical instruments are rich.The well maintained, distinctive Victorian building is situated mid-block on a skinny, cherry tree-lined street, with all conveniences beginning at the corners of the block and continuing. Prime sunny spot in Eureka Valley. The corner health food store, yoga studio, large grocery, tennis court, several public transportation choices are all 2 minutes away. Shops, restaurants, Castro Theater, too.  Easy on-street parking with 'S' sticker.  Walk 5 minutes to Dolores Park.  Great for bicycling.Nice bathroom with 6' claw-foot tub and great shower over it, window, cupboard space, etc.I am a busy visual artist, vegetarian, nature explorer, public radio and classical and jazz appreciator, bicycler, etc., who has rented this flat for 16 years. I have put my heart into it, and towards evolving the shared back gardens (8 flats in the building with very busy professionals)  The photo of the avocados is from a pit I planted early on, and it adorns the back deck. (one flight up)  There is a huge dine-in kitchen with gas stove, lots of empty cupboard and counter space and utensils, etc.  The kitchen has 3 Easterly facing windows and door out to the back deck with furnishings.  It's one flight down to the double-wide lot of back gardens, that I have included a few photos of.  Also: (apple, pomegranate, mandarin orange, lemon, lime, apricot, plum, peach, cherry trees, and assorted berries, and decorative plants)I keep the flat's general areas clean with natural cleaners.  Shoes come off at the front door.Two private rooms, and shared communal spaces with myself.  Monthly rent: $2,400. Utilities are generally $60 - $80/month.  (comcast and pg&e)Covid-19 conscious and fully vaccinated.  Responsible.  References.  One month's security deposit. n/s, n/d. Thanks for your interest in my listing!Judy

title: High ceiling Studio with Sleeping loft in Landmark Victorian
description: Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness. Studio with separate sleeping loft. = 1BR. $1780 (single occupant rate). Living room and separate bedroom. $2095.00 Security deposit = 1.75 rent with good credit. College students with parent co-signers ok. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places. National Register #75000473San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian façade and birdcage elevator. The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage. Janis Joplin lived in the building in the early sixties, as did Wes Wilson,  the artist who created the first Psychedelic posters for the musical events at the Avalon-Family Dog and Fillmore-Bill Graham venues.Several unique units available with lofts and/or with separate bedrooms. New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on 2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck. Non-smoking building. Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby

title: Beautiful fully remodeled 2 bedroom apartment near dolores park
description: Beautiful two-bedroom apartment that was recently completely remodeled (to the suds) located on a great location on Sanchez between 17th and 18th. It is on the first floor of a 3-story building with only 6 units, and it gets a lot of light throughout the whole day. It has hardwood floors throughout and the kitchen is fully equipped with brand new high efficiency stainless steel appliances (dishwasher, gas stove, refrigerator, and microwave hood) amazing new quartz countertops and new stylish tiles on the floor. There is also a brand-new washer and a gas dryer exclusively for this apartment. The bathroom has brand new modern tiles and is equipped with a walk-in shower and a glass enclosure. All walls were recently replaced with new double layer sheetrock to provide an extra layer of soundproofing and insulation was installed throughout the unit and along with the new central gas heater (for this unit only), will make sure the apartment stays warm. New plumbing and new electrical wiring and all rooms are prewired for high-speed internet and cable ready. All windows are double pane insulated and new doors and new crown moldings were installed throughout along with new spotlights in the kitchen, hallway and living room for a nice stylish look! The 2 rooms have more than adequate closet space. Also, there is a video intercom installed, so you can see, talk, and buzz in whomever is at the front entrance of the building. It is located only 4-5 blocks from Castro, one block from sunny Dolores Park and only 3 blocks from Market Street. It has a walk score of 99 as there is a muni stop one block away as well as tech shuttle stops for most major companies. This location is a walker's paradise as there are several restaurants, shops, and bars all within walking distance.Just recently we remodeled the shared back yard with beautiful plants. It is ideal for sunbathing and barbecuing. It is an excellent location and a very settled neighborhood.Water and garbage are paid by landlord.At the viewing, please wear a mask! Hand sanitizer will be available inside the unit. All surfaces are fully sanitized before and after every appointment. Only intended occupants can join a socially distanced viewing appointment.Income Requirements: Combined Gross Income needs to be at least 3x the monthly rent.1 Month Security deposit required. 1 year lease required. Rent controlled buildingSORRY No garage (street parking only). NO PETS.NO SMOKERSCALL MARIA @  show contact info
